0.title: $11 trillion wiped out in worst losing streak for global stocks since 2008 crisis
0.article_body: As much as $11 trillion has been wiped out from the markets amid the worst losing streak for global stocks since the 2008 financial crisis, Bloomberg reported. The valuations of companies across the US and Europe have lowered due to the selloff in MSCI ACWI Index, MSCI's global equity index. Morgan Stanley and Citigroup strategists expect stocks to fall further.

1.title: I'm 'personally liable' for $750 mn SoftBank loan: Better.com's Vishal Garg
1.article_body: Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg admitted that he "personally guaranteed" $750 million cash infusion provided to the company last year and he's "personally liable" for it. In an email to employees, Garg wrote, "I'm fully committed with everything I own and will ever own." He said the "SoftBank $750 million loan comes due around my 50th birthday", five years from now.

2.title: I created a cave, ate red meat 3 times a day: Ranveer on playing 'Khilji'
2.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that while preparing for the role of Alauddin Khilji in the movie 'Padmaavat', he created cave-like space for himself. "I lived there...and breathed there," he said, adding that he used to eat red meat three times a day. "I was like...it should come straight from my gut. I thought it will affect my temperament," Ranveer said.

3.title: Ashish Nehra's street smart, knows what you need to succeed: Manjrekar
3.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar praised Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra and called the latter "street smart". "He's street smart, and knows what you need to succeed in cricket because his career has been like that," Manjrekar added. "If you become a friend to players...you keep them in a good mental space, then the team's performance changes," he added.

4.title: UK confirms 2 new monkeypox cases a week after reporting 1st case
4.article_body: UK's Health Security Agency (UKHSA) on Saturday confirmed two new monkeypox cases in England a week after the country reported its first case of the rare viral infection. It stated that the new cases are not linked to the previous case. "While investigations remain ongoing...it's important to emphasise [that the infection] doesn't spread easily," a UKHSA official said.

5.title: Entire nation is thrilled: PM congratulates men's badminton team on Thomas Cup win
5.article_body: After the Indian men's badminton team won the Thomas Cup for the first time ever, PM Narendra Modi congratulated the team saying, "The entire nation is elated." He added, "This win will motivate so many upcoming sportspersons." India created history by defeating 14-time champions Indonesia 3-0 on Sunday.

6.title: Hasaranga's 2/15 vs PBKS was equivalent to ton off 40 balls: Tendulkar
6.article_body: Praising RCB spinner Wanindu Hasaranga for his performance against PBKS, Sachin Tendulkar said conceding 15 runs in an innings where 209 were scored is equivalent to scoring a hundred off 40 balls. "Very impressed with the way Hasaranga bowled. He always seems to pick up wickets in crucial phases," added Sachin. Currently, Hasaranga has 23 wickets from 13 games.

7.title: Kuldeep Sen has been a terrific find for Rajasthan Royals: Vaughan
7.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan praised Rajasthan Royals fast bowler Kuldeep Sen and said, "Kuldeep has been a terrific find for Rajasthan." Vaughan also recalled Kuldeep's IPL debut against LSG where he defended 15 runs in the last over bowling to Marcus Stoinis. "He has got eight wickets [in seven IPL 2022 matches so far], bowls the key overs," Vaughan added.

8.title: Get jitters, can't sleep day before: Asees on nervousness before song releases
8.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur said that she gets the jitters and can't sleep a day before the release of her songs. "This nervousness will go on till my last song," she said, adding that when she entered the industry, she sang every song that was offered to her and that she is now cautious while choosing projects.

9.title: B'luru men withdraw cash after stealing senior citizen's ATM card; held
9.article_body: A gang of thieves was arrested in Bengaluru for withdrawing thousands of rupees from a senior citizen's ATM card as he had written its PIN on it. The man was walking on the roadside when the accused stole his wallet and mobile phone on May 11. Three men were arrested by police, while some of them managed to run away.

10.title: Akshay, Vidya iconic; didn't want to waste: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director
10.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee has stated that the characters portrayed by Akshay Kumar and Vidya Balan in the first film were larger than life and iconic. "I didn't want to waste them. I am sure when people will watch the film, they will support my decision," the director added. 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' features Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani.

11.title: Here are some more: Ira to trolls who criticised her for wearing bikini on b'day
11.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter, Ira Khan, reacted to trolls who criticised her for wearing a bikini as she celebrated her birthday with her family and friends. Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Ira shared new pictures with her friends and her boyfriend Nupur Shikhare, and wrote, "If everyone is done hating and trolling my last birthday photo dump...here are some more!"

12.title: Coup to remove Putin is underway in Russia: Ukrainian military spy chief
12.article_body: A coup to overthrow Russian President Vladimir Putin is underway, Ukraine's head of military intelligence has said, adding, "It is impossible to stop it." Major General Kyrylo Budanov said that if Russia lost the war in Ukraine, Putin will be removed and there will be a change of leadership of the Russian Federation.

13.title: 2 Sikh men shot dead in Pakistan, second such incident in 8 months
13.article_body: Two men from Pakistan's minority Sikh community were shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Peshawar city on Sunday, reports said. The deceased men were identified by a policeman as Ranjit Singh and Kanwal Jeet Singh. Gunmen on a motorcycle shot them multiple times before fleeing, the policeman added. This is the second such incident in the last eight months.

14.title: All doesn't seem well in CSK's camp: Aakash Chopra
14.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said CSK are a "strong and successful franchise" but "all doesn't seem to be well" in their camp in the ongoing IPL season. "Ravindra Jadeja left (bio-bubble), then Ambati Rayudu announced retirement before unretiring. There's a different game that's happening there with Rayudu," he added. CSK have lost eight of their 12 games so far.

15.title: Flight to B'luru delayed, passengers wait at Pune Airport for 4 hrs
15.article_body: Passengers onboard the Bengaluru-bound Go First flight were made to wait in the aircraft at Pune Airport for four hours after their flight was delayed. The flight was scheduled to take off at 10:50 pm on May 14. However, the flight took off four hours later at 3:24 am on May 15 due to a technical error.

16.title: Vir Das compares his mom's Lajpat Nagar shopping to Elon Musk buying Twitter
16.article_body: Comedian Vir Das compared his mother's Lajpat Nagar shopping to Elon Musk buying Twitter, and wrote, "Musk is my mom with rockets." Das said his mother "would go into one shop, like something...pretend not to like it too much...and drive the price down". "Other shopkeepers...would offer her better deals," Das said, adding that "she'd come back to the same shop".

17.title: Russia has lost one third of its ground combat force in Ukraine: UK
17.article_body: The UK has estimated that Russia has probably lost "one third of the ground combat force it committed in February". "Despite small-scale initial advances, Russia has failed to achieve substantial territorial gains over...past month whilst sustaining consistently high levels of attrition," it said. Russia is unlikely to dramatically accelerate its rate of advance over the next 30 days, it claimed.

18.title: 4 held with 10 illegal weapons, 15 cartridges in Haryana's Mahendragarh
18.article_body: Four persons were arrested by the Haryana Police after 10 illegal weapons and 15 cartridges were recovered from their possession in Mahendragarh. Following a tip-off that the accused were roaming in the Ateli area with illegal weapons, police conducted a raid and arrested the accused, leading to the recovery of the weapons and cartridges.

19.title: 6 including kids, soldiers killed in suicide bomb blast in Pak
19.article_body: Three children and three soldiers were killed in a suicide bomb blast in Pakistan's North Waziristan district, the media wing of the country's army ISPR said on Sunday. ISPR added that intelligence agencies are "investigating to find out about [the] suicide bomber and his handlers/facilitators", the news agency Dawn reported. The suicide bomber had attacked a military vehicle, officials said.

20.title: Rioters tried to sabotage reporter Akleh's funeral: Israeli Police
20.article_body: Israeli Police said in a statement on Saturday that it'll conduct an investigation after police and mourners carrying Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh's coffin clashed during her funeral ceremony. It added that the police had coordinated with Akleh's family, however, "hundreds of rioters tried to sabotage the ceremony and harm the police". Six people were arrested in the incident.

21.title: Delhi Police summons Raj minister Mahesh Joshi's son by May 18 in rape case
21.article_body: A Delhi Police team that reached Jaipur to arrest Rajasthan Minister Dr Mahesh Joshi's son Rohit in an alleged rape case pasted a summon notice outside his house after he was found absconding. The police asked him to appear before it by May 18. A 23-year-old complainant has alleged that Rohit raped her on several occasions.

22.title: To the most beautiful woman in the world: Shriram Nene on wife Madhuri's b'day
22.article_body: On actress Madhuri Dixit's birthday, her husband Dr Shriram Nene shared a birthday message for her. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "Happy Birthday to the most beautiful woman in the world, my wife...my best friend! I love you so much and you deserve nothing but the absolute best. Wishing you a wonderful birthday and many amazing years to come, together."

23.title: DMK leader booked after Dalit panchayat official kills self in TN
23.article_body: DMK panchayat union ward councillor V Hari has been booked under SC/ST Act and is facing abetment of suicide charge after a 39-year-old village panchayat official killed himself near Tamil Nadu's Vellore. Hari allegedly refused to return ₹2.5 lakh he took from the victim after failing to provide a job to his brother as promised.

24.title: UAE-based telecom group acquires 9.8% stake in Vodafone Group for $4.4 billion
24.article_body: Emirates Telecommunications Group Company PJSC (e&) has acquired a 9.8% stake in Vodafone Group for $4.4 billion. With this, the UAE-based company has become the largest shareholder in Vodafone, Bloomberg reported. e& said that it has "made the investment in Vodafone to gain significant exposure to a world leader in connectivity and digital services".

25.title: All the boys played fearless cricket: Shreyas on KKR's 54-run vs SRH
25.article_body: Following KKR's 54-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said everyone in the team played fearless cricket. "The mindset we came up with in this game was simply outstanding. All the boys did the right things...everything panned out really well," he added. All-rounder Andre Russell was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 3/22 and 49*(28).

26.title: Nepal visit to further deepen time-honoured linkages: PM Modi
26.article_body: A day ahead of his visit to Nepal, PM Narendra Modi said that India's ties with the country are unparalleled. "My visit is intended to celebrate and further deepen these time-honoured linkages that have been fostered through centuries and recorded in our long history of intermingling," he said. PM will visit Lumbini on the occasion of Buddha Purnima.

27.title: Heavy rain warning issued for Kerala, orange alert issued for 6 districts
27.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued warning of heavy rain in Kerala for next five days. An orange alert has been issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam and Thrissur districts till May 16. IMD advised fishermen to not venture into the sea and said squally weather with wind speed reaching 40-50 kmph is likely to prevail over Kerala coast.

28.title: CSK to bat first against GT, make 4 changes to their playing XI
28.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bat first against GT in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. Table-toppers GT are fielding the same playing XI, while CSK have made four changes to their playing XI. N Jagadeesan, Prashant Solanki, Mitchell Santner and Matheesha Pathirana have beeing included by CSK.

29.title: Credit not given to Indian content until international recognition: Tanuj
29.article_body: Actor Tanuj Virwani, whose short film 'Parchhaiyaan' will be screened at Cannes, said that not enough credit is given to Indian content until it gets international recognition. He further said there is a lot more that creators need to do to promote short films in India. "There's this common misconception that...a short film...has to be an arthouse film," Tanuj added.

30.title: B'luru BPO employee stabbed to death by drunk friend after argument
30.article_body: A 30-year-old BPO employee in Bengaluru was killed after his friend stabbed him in an inebriated state. The victim, Jayakumar, had taken a loan in his wife's name and his friend Rahil was paying the EMIs. When Rahil forgot to pay one instalment, an argument broke out between them and Rahil stabbed Jayakumar with a knife.

31.title: Williamson should take a break, give SRH captaincy to someone else: Sehwag
31.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said SRH captain Kane Williamson should take a break and give the captaincy to someone else for their remaining games in IPL 2022. "How will the team fight when their leader isn't doing well...Abhishek Sharma is trying to make the most of the powerplay, but isn't getting the support from the other end," added Sehwag.

32.title: Indian men's badminton team creates history, wins Thomas Cup for the first time ever
32.article_body: The Indian men's badminton team created history on Sunday after winning Thomas Cup for the first time ever. India won the final 3-0 against defending champions Indonesia. Lakshya Sen and Kidambi Srikanth won their singles' matches in the final against Anthony Sinisuka Ginting and Jonatan Christie, respectively. Meanwhile, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won their men's doubles clash.

33.title: CM Baghel suggests Cong leaders to visit temples outside polls too: Reports
33.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has reportedly suggested at Congress' ongoing 'Chintan Shivir' to visit temples outside the poll cycles as well. "Leaders should participate in religious functions on a regular basis...Only then can perceptions be changed," CM Baghel is learnt to have said. Notably, his suggestion was reportedly supported by several Congress leaders from the Hindi-speaking states.

34.title: Jakhar has to bear brunt of Congress' poor politics: AAP leader
34.article_body: After Sunil Jakhar quit Congress, AAP leader Malwinder Singh Kang said today Jakhar has to bear the brunt of the poor politics of Congress. "The Congress divides people to get votes and today that resulted in the resignation of their former state president," Kang added. Congress has always pursued power through caste and religion-based politics, separating the people, Kang stated.

35.title: Giant boulder falls into Tamil Nadu quarry, 4 trapped inside 300-ft deep pit
35.article_body: Four workers are trapped inside a 300-feet deep quarry in Tamil Nadu's Tirunelveli district after a giant boulder rolled down into the pit on Saturday night. Asra Garg, Inspector General of Police, Southern Range said that two people were rescued from the quarry by the fire service officials. A helicopter was also roped in to carry out the rescue operations.

36.title: Will let you know with a bang: KGF producers on rumours of KGF 3 starting soon
36.article_body: 'KGF' producers announced that they would not be starting with the third instalment anytime soon. Taking to Twitter on Saturday, executive producer Karthik Gowda said, "The news doing the rounds are all speculation. With a lot of exciting projects ahead of us, we'll...not be starting #KGF3 anytime soon. We'll let you know with a bang when we start the work."

37.title: No challenge for BJP in Tripura: Manik Saha after taking oath as CM
37.article_body: After taking oath as Tripura's new Chief Minister, Manik Saha has claimed that there is "no political challenge" to BJP in Tripura. "We will move forward with the development issue of PM Modi...We will also enhance law and order in the state along with resolving the issues of the people of Tripura," CM Saha said.

38.title: Drugs worth over ₹1 lakh seized in Pune, 3 men arrested
38.article_body: Over 3.5 kg of marijuana and six grams of heroin worth more than ₹1 lakh have been seized in separate cases in Pune's Sutarwadi Pashan and Wanawadi areas. The city police's anti-narcotics cell has arrested three people in this connection. Officers said that one of the accused, aged 30, was arrested from Kaushambi in Uttar Pradesh.

39.title: Devasahayam becomes 1st Indian layman to be declared saint by the Pope
39.article_body: A Hindu man from Tamil Nadu, who converted to Christianity in 1745, became the first non-ordained Indian (a layman) to be declared a saint by Pope Francis at the Vatican on Sunday. Devasahayam Pillai, who took the name Lazarus, has been granted sainthood for "enduring increasing hardships" after embracing Christianity, the Vatican earlier said.

40.title: As with Warne in March, Symonds' innings ended way too soon: Adani
40.article_body: Businessman Gautam Adani condoled former Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds' death in a car accident aged 46. "As with Warne in March, Symonds' innings ended way too soon," Adani tweeted, referring to former Australia cricketer Shane Warne's death aged 52 in March 2022. "Shocked by the loss of Symonds who epitomized presence both on and off the field," Adani added.

41.title: Reliance to buy dozens of brands for its consumer goods business: Report
41.article_body: Reliance Industries is planning to acquire dozens of small grocery and non-food brands as it targets building its own $6.5 billion consumer goods business, Reuters reported. The company is reportedly planning to build a portfolio of 50-60 grocery, household and personal care brands. As per Reuters, it is in final stages of negotiations with around 30 popular local consumer brands.

42.title: Well done: Irfan on Umran's 3/33 vs KKR after going wicketless in 3 games
42.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised SRH pacer Umran Malik's performance in their match against KKR on Saturday. "Push him when [he] does well, back him when he doesn't. He is still young but with tons of potential. Well done my boy," tweeted Irfan. Umran picked three wickets against KKR after going wicketless in his last three matches.

43.title: Denial of justice will lead to anarchy: CJI Ramana
43.article_body: Highlighting the need of speedy justice for a healthy democracy, Chief Justice of India N V Ramana on Saturday said, "Denial of justice will ultimately lead to anarchy." "Peace shall only prevail when people's dignity and rights are recognised and protected," he added at a Srinagar event. He further said, "We are far from making our courts inclusive and accessible."

44.title: Better.com allows India employees to leave, accepts 920 resignations: Report
44.article_body: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com recently offered its employees in India the option to leave under a voluntary separation agreement, TechCrunch reported. Around 90% of the 2,100 employees took the offer, more than the company expected, and eventually, the resignations of 920 employees were accepted. In December 2021, Better.com CEO Vishal Garg had fired 900 employees over a Zoom call.

45.title: Kissing, fondling boy not unnatural offences: HC while granting bail to man
45.article_body: Kissing a 14-year-old boy on the lips and touching his private parts don't constitute unnatural offences under IPC section 377, the Bombay HC said. It said this while granting bail to a man arrested last year for kissing and inappropriately touching the boy. The judge noted that the medical test on the boy didn't support his statement of sexual assault.

46.title: Kashmiri Pandit's killing was targeted, SIT to probe case: J&K Lt Guv
46.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has said that the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists was a "targeted one". He added that SIT will probe the case and also investigate the use of force against Kashmiri migrant protestors in the aftermath of the incident. This comes after police lathicharged and fired tear gas shells against protesters.

47.title: London-based CEO offers to pay employees in gold to beat inflation
47.article_body: London-based Cameron Parry, the CEO of financial services company TallyMoney, has offered his employees the possibility to get paid in gold rather than pounds in order to beat inflation. "With the cost of living crisis going from bad to worse, it didn't make sense to continue offering pay hikes in pounds when its value is being eroded further," Parry said.

48.title: Man booked for sexually harassing 16-yr-old girl in Gurugram's Pataudi
48.article_body: A man was booked for sexually harassing a 16-year-old girl in Pataudi, Gurugram. The girl's mother alleged that the accused, who was their neighbour, was forcing the girl to marry him and had even posted her photos on Facebook after she refused the marriage proposal, police said. The accused has been booked under the POCSO Act and the IT Act.

49.title: Ajay will never promote my film; Akshay won't support me publicly: Kangana
49.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said she has received no support from the celebrities in Bollywood. When asked to comment on Ajay Devgn's statement about 'Bollywood Bonhomie', Kangana said, "Ajay...will never promote my film. He will promote other films but will never promote my film." "Akshay (Kumar)...called me, quietly, to tell...'I love your Thalaivi' but he'll not tweet my trailer," she added.

50.title: Many leaders to soon leave Congress: Ex-Union Minister
50.article_body: Many leaders will leave Congress soon and the party president Sonia Gandhi knows the reason behind this, ex-Union Minister Ashwani Kumar said. Reacting to Sunil Jakhar's decision to quit Congress, Kumar said it is a "big loss" for the party. "The biggest reason the leaders are leaving Congress is the lack of respect for them within the party," Kumar added.

51.title: Swiggy delivery boy killed by garbage truck in Bengaluru, 4th death in 2 months
51.article_body: A Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) garbage truck killed a 25-year-old Swiggy delivery boy at Bengaluru's Nagawara-Thanisandra main road. The deceased, identified as Devanna, had hit a divider before colliding with the truck while heading to Hegde Nagar, police said. Notably, this is the fourth time in the past two months that a BBMP truck has killed a person.

52.title: I told Hardik to control his emotions on field: Mohammad Shami
52.article_body: GT pacer Mohammad Shami has said their captain Hardik Pandya has "mellowed down" with the leadership responsibility in the ongoing IPL season. "I have advised him to control his emotions on the field because the entire world watches cricket...It is very important as a leader to be sensible," added Shami. Currently, GT are at the top of IPL points table.

53.title: Tharoor posts pics from Cong Chintan Shivir, says 'Amicable solutions found'
53.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday shared pictures from the party's Chintan Shivir event, calling it an "excellent opportunity to catch up" with colleagues. Views were "passionately" debated and "amicable" solutions were found during the discussions, he said. He also shared a group selfie with Mahila Congress delegates, adding, "A varied and diverse turnout was a feature of the...event."

54.title: Why was Andrew Symonds called 'Roy'?
54.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds, who passed away aged 46, earned his longstanding nickname 'Roy' during his childhood. The name was reportedly given to him by a junior sports coach for his likeness to former American-Australian basketball player Leroy Loggins, who played in National Basketball League (Australia) from 1981 to 2001. Symonds was an avid basketball fan while growing up.

55.title: Delhi Police arrest building owner Manish Lakra after Delhi fire incident
55.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested building owner Manish Lakra in connection with the Mundka fire incident that killed 27 people in the national capital. Police said that the arrest was made after conducting multiple raids in Delhi and Haryana. The police had earlier arrested two factory owners in the case. The father of the factory owners also died in the fire.

56.title: Crane driver saves 50 people from Delhi fire, says 'fire tenders came after 1.5 hours'
56.article_body: Dayanand Tiwari, a crane operator saved over 50 lives after the fire in Delhi on Friday which claimed at least 27 lives, reported ANI. "I was coming from Mundka Udyog Nagar when I saw the fire in the building. With the crane's help, we rescued around 50-55 people, mostly women," he said. "Fire tenders reached after 1.5 hours," he added.

57.title: NCP workers allegedly attack BJP leader in Pune; video surfaces
57.article_body: A video of BJP leader Vinayak Ambekar being allegedly attacked at his office in Pune by 20 NCP workers has surfaced online. This comes as an NCP worker filed a complaint against Ambekar over a purported demeaning post he wrote against the former's party chief Sharad Pawar. Ambekar claimed that he was "slapped" and that his spectacles broke.

58.title: Mass protests held across US in support of abortion rights
58.article_body: Thousands of people took to streets in support of abortion rights across US. The protesters marched to "Bans Off Our Bodies" slogan in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago and other cities. "For the women of this country, this will be a summer of rage," said a protester. "If it's a fight they want, it's a fight they'll get," she added.

59.title: Hard work paid off vs SRH, hopefully KKR can qualify for playoffs: Russell
59.article_body: After winning against SRH by 54 runs on Saturday, KKR all-rounder Andre Russell has said that he is hopeful of KKR's chances to qualify for the IPL 2022 Playoffs. "Hard work paid off today. Good to contribute in both aspects...Hopefully, we can qualify," said Russell, after scoring 49*(28) and picking up three scalps in the match.

60.title: Jakhar was never and will never be ignored by Congress: Harish Rawat
60.article_body: After Sunil Jakhar quit the Congress, party leader Harish Rawat said Jakhar was never and will never be ignored by the party. "The decision is in his hands, whether he wants to stay in the party or not," Rawat added. Jakhar's announcement came weeks after party leadership issued him a show-cause notice over his criticism of Charanjit Singh Channi.

61.title: 2 held for stabbing 22-yr-old man, his friend in Ambala over enmity
61.article_body: Two persons were arrested a day after a group of men allegedly stabbed a 22-year-old man and his friend at the Ambala City bus stand over an old enmity. "He stabbed us with a knife, while I managed to run and attack him with a brick in self-defence. His aides joined him and the group attacked us," a victim said.

62.title: Maoists set 10 vehicles on fire in Jharkhand's Latehar
62.article_body: Maoists torched 10 vehicles that were being used for the construction of roads and bridges in Jharkhand's Latehar district. Eight vehicles were set ablaze in Baskarcha village while two other vehicles were set on fire in the district's Potmadih village. "Maoists took the responsibility for the incident, issuing a leaflet," Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Rajesh Kujur said.

63.title: Woman, lover kill husband who used to 'beat her' in Delhi; held
63.article_body: The Delhi Police on Saturday arrested a woman and her lover for allegedly murdering her husband. The police had reportedly found the husband's body inside a house in Kalkaji a day earlier with stab wounds on his neck. The woman claimed she had decided to kill her husband out of rage as he used to "beat her regularly".

64.title: Voting for parliamentary elections underway in Lebanon
64.article_body: Voting for the parliamentary elections in Lebanon began on Sunday. This is the first parliamentary election in the country since 2018, when Hezbollah and its allies won 71 out of 128 seats. The election is being held at a time when the country is going through an economic crisis for which the World Bank has blamed the ruling class.

65.title: Khargone collector, SP transferred 1 month after Ram Navami violence
65.article_body: More than one month after violence took place in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, state government has transferred the district's collector, Anugraha P and Superintendent of Police (SP), Siddharth Choudhary. Government order said Ratlam's Collector Kumar Purushottam will be the new collector of Khargone. Meanwhile, Satna district Superintendent of Police DharamVir Singh will now be SP of Khargone.

66.title: Yuzvendra Chahal shares pics with Andrew Symonds, says 'I have lost my closest man'
66.article_body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal took to Instagram to pen a note following the demise of former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds. "Today I have lost my closest man...He always had his guiding arm around my shoulders...He even taught me how to enjoy life to the fullest," Chahal wrote. Chahal and Symonds played together for MI in IPL 2011.

67.title: Orange alert in Delhi after 47°C maximum temperature recorded on Saturday
67.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert for Delhi after the national capital recorded a maximum temperature of 47 degrees Celsius on Saturday. Meanwhile, IMD also issued an orange alert for Gurugram after the city recorded its highest temperature of the season at 46.8°C on Saturday. Reports said that thunderstorm and dust storm are also likely in Delhi.

68.title: Manik Saha takes oath as 11th Chief Minister of Tripura
68.article_body: Tripura BJP chief Manik Saha on Sunday took oath as the 11th Chief Minister of the state at Raj Bhavan in Agartala, a day after Biplab Kumar Deb resigned from the post. Previously in the Congress, Saha joined BJP in 2016 and was made state unit president in 2020. He was elected to the Rajya Sabha in March this year.

69.title: I would like to see myself as leg-spinning all-rounder in future: Bishnoi
69.article_body: LSG's 21-year-old spinner Ravi Bishnoi has said he would like to see himself in a role of a leg-spinning all-rounder in the near future. "I'm working very hard on my batting and will try my best to be a match-winner with the bat," he added. So far, Bishnoi has picked nine wickets in 11 games in IPL 2022.

70.title: Protest at J&K university as prof sacked over alleged terror links
70.article_body: Students held a protest at Srinagar's Kashmir University on Saturday after Jammu and Kashmir administration decided to dismiss the university's Chemistry Professor Dr Altaf Hussain Pandit over alleged terror links. This is believed to be the first time that a government employee's dismissal over alleged terror links has been met with protests. A student called Pandit the "most dedicated" teacher.

71.title: I barely saw any money during my childhood; didn't even have TV at home: Pankaj
71.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi spoke about his childhood and how he barely saw any money. He said, "I'm the son of a farmer and growing up in a remote village in Bihar, we had barely seen any money. My parents didn't even have a television at home." "I have grown up understanding the value and vice of money," he added.

72.title: Ahir protest likely to disrupt NH48 traffic, Gurugram Police issues advisory
72.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police have issued traffic advisory for Sunday as traffic movement on the National Highway 48 is likely to be disrupted in view of the protest by the members of the Ahir community. Advisory said commuters from Jaipur can reach destination via Pataudi-Gurgaon road, while MG road commuters have been advised to take left before IFFCO Chowk slip road.

73.title: Russian embassy employees in US being threatened: Envoy Antonov
73.article_body: Russian Ambassador to US Anatoly Antonov claimed on Saturday that the employees of the country's embassy in Washington DC are receiving threats, reported TASS. "[The embassy is] like a besieged fortress," he said. Furthermore, he claimed that US security agents were "hanging around outside our building" and handing out CIA and FBI phone numbers. This comes amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

74.title: Andre Russell is absolutely gold dust: Aakash Chopra
74.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra praised KKR all-rounder Andre Russell for scoring a match-winning 49*(28) and picking up three wickets against SunRisers Hyderabad on Saturday. "Andre in, ball out and then Andre in, batter out. I mean he won the Russell vs Hyderabad match...Andre does the bowler's job...and the batter's job also. He is absolutely gold dust," Chopra said.

75.title: Andrew Symonds was the most expensive overseas player in first-ever IPL auction
75.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds, who passed away aged 46, was the most expensive overseas player in the first-ever IPL auction in 2008. He was bought by now-defunct Deccan Chargers for $1.35 million. Symonds played three seasons for Deccan Chargers before playing for Mumbai Indians in 2011. Symonds scored 974 runs and took 20 wickets in 39 IPL matches.

76.title: Asked Shahid, 'Were you dancing or flying?': Sukhwinder Singh on Haider's song
76.article_body: Speaking about song Bismil in 'Haider', singer Sukhwinder Singh said, "The song made me feel like I was once again sitting in one of those dreaded Maths classes but the final result was like qayamat." "Also, I've to compliment Shahid Kapoor, who I couldn't help but ask, 'Tum naachte ho ki udte ho?' (Were you dancing or flying?)," he added.

77.title: Sri Lankans protest outside PM's residence, demand ex-PM's arrest
77.article_body: Several Sri Lankans staged a protest outside newly-appointed PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's residence, demanding the arrest of his predecessor Mahinda Rajapaksa. "We do not trust Ranil Wickremesinghe as he is a family member and a very good friend of the Rajapaksa family," said a protester. Wickremesinghe can prove he can do justice if he gets Rajapaksa arrested, added the protester.

78.title: Delhi Police reach Jaipur to arrest Raj minister Mahesh Joshi's son in rape case
78.article_body: A team of Delhi Police on Sunday reached Jaipur to arrest Rajasthan minister Dr Mahesh Joshi's son Rohit in an alleged rape case acting on an FIR filed by a 23-year-old woman. Rohit was found to be absconding, police said. According to the complainant, Rohit raped her on several occasions between January 8 last year and April 17 this year.

79.title: I certainly did: Clarke on whether he bought Symonds a drink after 2006 'freak dismissal'
79.article_body: Following ex-cricketer Andrew Symonds' demise, Cricket Australia tweeted a video of his 'freak dismissal' in a 2006 ODI. Symonds was caught after ball ricocheted off non-striker Michael Clarke's body. While going back, Symonds gestured Clarke owed him a beer. Commenting on the video, a fan asked Clarke whether he bought Symonds a drink, to which Clarke replied, "I certainly did."

80.title: We've lost another one of our heroes: Maxwell on Andrew Symonds' demise
80.article_body: Reacting to the news of former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds passing away in a car accident on Saturday night, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell tweeted, "Can't believe what I've just woken up to." Maxwell also expressed condolences, stating, "Thinking of his family, his teammates and everyone in the cricket community. We've lost another one of our heroes."

81.title: 3 persons held from UP for links with sex determination racket in Kurukshetra
81.article_body: Three persons were arrested by the Kurukshetra Police from UP for having alleged links with a pre-natal sex determination racket busted by the police earlier this week. Two women were already arrested earlier for helping a decoy customer conduct a gender test at ₹32,000, Additional Superintendent of Police, Karan Goel, said.

82.title: Heavy rains wash away portion of road, trigger landslides in Assam; 3 dead
82.article_body: A portion of a road was washed away due to rains in the Haflong area in Assam's Dima Hasao district. Three people died in Haflong area as heavy rains triggered landslides in several parts of the district. ANI reported that landslides were reported from 12 villages in Dima Hasao and that 80 houses were severely affected.

83.title: 22-yr-old arrested for stealing ₹17 lakh from ATM in Gurugram
83.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly breaking into an ATM and attacking policemen around eight months ago near Gurugram's Chandu village. The accused, identified as Mohammad Taslim, had withdrawn ₹17 lakh from the ATM with the help of a gas cutter, police said. Two other suspects are still on the run while police have recovered around ₹10,500 from Taslim.

84.title: Nigerian student lynched over blasphemy; protests to free suspects
84.article_body: Mass protests broke out in Nigeria's Sokoto demanding release of the suspects arrested in connection with the lynching of a student over blasphemy. Deborah Samuel was reportedly stoned, beaten and burnt by a mob for allegedly posting blasphemous statements against the Prophet Muhammad on social media. Following the protests, Sokoto Governor imposed a 24-hour curfew on Saturday.

85.title: Brown sugar worth ₹3 cr seized in Odisha's Puri, 3 held
85.article_body: Three persons were arrested after the Odisha Police, in a joint operation with the Special Task Force (STF), seized more than 3 kg of brown sugar worth ₹3 crore in Puri. "Based on the investigation, it was found that the three were inter-district suppliers," Kanwar Vishal Singh, SP, said. The police have also seized ₹20,000 cash.

86.title: Shocking news for all of us to absorb: Sachin Tendulkar on Andrew Symonds' demise
86.article_body: Following the demise of 46-year-old former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "[His] demise is shocking news for all of us to absorb. Not only was he a brilliant all-rounder, but also a live-wire on the field. I've fond memories of the time we spent together in Mumbai Indians." Symonds passed away in a road accident on Saturday night.

87.title: Musk says 'Twitter users being manipulated in ways they don't realise', Dorsey replies
87.article_body: Elon Musk said Twitter users are being manipulated by the algorithm in ways they don't realise. He tweeted, "Very important to fix your Twitter feed: Tap home button, tap stars on upper right and select 'Latest tweets'." Reacting to it, former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey said, "It was designed simply to save you time when you are away from app."

88.title: Case against 3 for distorting historical facts in class 12 books in Punjab
88.article_body: A case was registered against three people over alleged distortion of historical facts in class 12 books. Farmer leader Baldev Singh Sirsa alleged that many historical facts were not in accordance with Sikh history. Those booked were identified as Manjit Singh Sodhi, writer of 'Modern ABC of History of Punjab', Mahinderpal Kaur and M S Mann, writer of 'History Punjab'.

89.title: Gone too soon: Rashid, Dhawan condole Andrew Symonds' demise
89.article_body: Condoling the demise of former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds, Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan tweeted, "Saddened and shocked to hear the sudden demise of Andrew Symonds. A legend of the sport, gone too soon." India batter Shikhar Dhawan wrote, "Shocking news...My condolences to his family and friends. May God bless his soul." Symonds died in a car accident on Saturday night.

90.title: Tripura minister shouts, throws chair over CM choice; video surfaces
90.article_body: A video of Tripura minister Ram Prasad Paul reportedly shouting and throwing a chair following the decision to appoint Manik Saha as the CM of the state at a BJP meet has surfaced online. "Main mar jaunga (I will die)," Paul can be purportedly heard saying in the video. Saha is the President of the state BJP unit.

91.title: Duo carrying cocaine worth ₹16 lakh arrested in Greater Noida
91.article_body: Two men carrying 200 grams of cocaine worth up to ₹16 lakh were arrested in Greater Noida, police said on Saturday. The duo allegedly supplied drugs to peddlers in the Delhi-NCR region. "On Thursday night…we spotted two men on a bike which had its number plate covered in mud. We asked them to stop and found the contraband," said police.

92.title: Never looked at him as a competitor: Zayed Khan on his cousin Fardeen Khan
92.article_body: When asked if his relationship with cousin, actor Fardeen Khan was impacted as they were contemporaries, actor Zayed Khan said, "I never looked at Fardeen as a competitor." He added Fardeen was his brother and they had intellectual conversations with each other. "We should've seen professionalism and brotherhood differently and [played] the game like that but we didn't," Zayed said.

93.title: Waheeda sent chocolates to Lata so she agrees to do stage shows with her: Alka
93.article_body: Singer Alka Yagnik said that actress Waheeda Rehman started sending chocolates to late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar so the latter agrees to do stage shows with her. Alka also said actress Madhubala was the first to start making contracts stating that only Lata Mangeshkar will sing her songs in films. "Every new actress wanted...someday Lataji should sing...for them," Alka added.

94.title: Out of 27 confirmed dead in Delhi fire incident, 21 are women: Report
94.article_body: Out of the 27 people who have been confirmed as dead in fire that broke out in office building near Delhi’s Mundka metro station, 21 are women, reports said. In missing persons’ list prepared by police, 24 out of the 29, feared to be among the dead, are women. Only eight victims, including five women, have been identified so far.

95.title: Gurugram sees season's highest temperature at 46.8°C; orange alert issued
95.article_body: Gurugram recorded its highest temperature of the season at 46.8°C on Saturday, which was about eight degrees above normal. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert and warned that the heatwave could continue for the next two days. The minimum temperature recorded was 27.3°C, about four degrees above normal, said IMD.

96.title: Russell is always a threat, he showed his class: Williamson
96.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said they've been struggling to create momentum after their defeat against KKR on Saturday. "Andre Russell is always a threat. Showed his class. We tried to create partnerships but KKR were really good," he added. Russell scored 49*(28) to help KKR post 177/6 and then took three wickets to help them win by 54 runs.

97.title: 2 Pune policemen arrested in ₹1.5 lakh bribery case
97.article_body: Two Pune Police officials and a third person have been arrested by Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for allegedly seeking a bribe for not filing an offence against a gas agency. One of the accused policemen allegedly demanded ₹2 lakh from an agency personnel and later settled for ₹1.5 lakh. The ACB laid a trap on the basis of a complaint.

98.title: Punjab govt being run with remote control from Delhi: Nadda
98.article_body: The government of Punjab is being run with remote control from Delhi via Chandigarh, BJP National President JP Nadda said. "MoUs have been signed between 16 departments in Delhi and Punjab. This means these departments will now be run by remote control from Delhi. Did the people of Punjab vote for this?" Nadda added.

99.title: Britney Spears announces she suffered a miscarriage, says 'We lost our miracle baby'
99.article_body: Singer Britney Spears took to Instagram to share that she has suffered a miscarriage. "It is with our deepest sadness we have to announce that we have lost our miracle baby early in the pregnancy. This is a devastating time for any parent," she wrote in a joint-statement with her fiancé Sam Asghari. Britney had announced her pregnancy in April.

100.title: Shreyas clarifies his 'CEO involved in team selections' remark after KKR face criticism
100.article_body: After KKR faced criticism following their captain Shreyas Iyer's remark that the CEO is involved in team selections, Shreyas issued a clarification.  Suggesting that the CEO isn't involved in team selections, Shreyas said, "When I took...CEO's name...I wanted...to say that he's there to console players who've been sitting out. It's...tough for us as well when we select the team."

101.title: Shocked: Harbhajan Singh after Andrew Symonds passes away in car accident
101.article_body: Condoling the demise of former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Shocked to hear about the sudden demise of Andrew Symonds. Gone too soon." He added, "Heartfelt condolences to the family and friends. Prayers for the departed soul." Symonds passed away in a car accident aged 46. Symonds played 26 Tests, 198 ODIs and 14 T20Is.

102.title: Andrew Symonds' last Instagram post before death was tribute to Shane Warne
102.article_body: Late Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds' last post on Instagram before death was a tribute to his close friend and spin legend Shane Warne, who passed away in March. "Devastated...I’m hoping this is all a bad dream I just can’t get my head around never seeing you again," Symonds had written. Symonds passed away in a car accident on Saturday night.

103.title: Twitter legal called to complain I violated NDA by revealing bot check sample size: Musk
103.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter's legal team accused him of violating a non-disclosure agreement by revealing that the sample size for the social media platform's checks on automated users is 100. Musk tweeted, "Twitter legal just called to complain that I violated their NDA by revealing the bot check sample size is 100! This actually happened."

104.title: People cautioned Razneesh about working with me; he didn't give up: Kangana
104.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said even though many people cautioned 'Dhaakad' director Razneesh Ghai about working with her, he still didn't give up on her. "A lot of people told him, 'You'll work with Kangana in your first film?'" she added. "Because my image has been spoiled. But despite...that, he said, 'I'll make this film only with Kangana'," she said.

105.title: Shocking news to wake up to: Laxman on demise of Andrew Symonds
105.article_body: Ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman took to Twitter to condole the demise of ex-Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds. He wrote, "Shocking news to wake up to here in India. Rest in peace my dear friend. Such tragic news." Symonds, who was part of Australia's World Cup-winning teams in 2003 and 2007, passed away in a car accident aged 46 on Saturday night.

106.title: Will you read Hanuman Chalisa there?: Thackeray to BJP over Bhat’s killing
106.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray reacted to the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat and asked if BJP would read Hanuman Chalisa there. "Our ‘Hindutva’ is ‘Gadadhari’," Thackeray added while addressing a rally in Mumbai. "Rahul Bhat was killed by terrorists at Tehsil’s office in J&K, now what will you (BJP) do? Will you read Hanuman Chalisa there?" he stated.

107.title: India reports 2,487 new COVID-19 cases, 13 deaths in last 24 hours
107.article_body: India has reported 2,487 COVID-19 cases, 2,878 recoveries and 13 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,858 COVID-19 cases and 11 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,692, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,214.

108.title: Pune records 62 new COVID-19 infections, active cases at 281
108.article_body: Pune district recorded 62 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday and the number of active cases stood at 281, according to authorities. Pune rural reported 10 new cases, Pune city saw 30, while 22 fresh infections were registered in PCMC. As many as 20,544 deaths have been recorded in the district since the pandemic began.

109.title: IGL increases CNG price by ₹2 per kg in Delhi-NCR
109.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) by ₹2 per kg in Delhi-NCR. The price rise has come into effect from 6 am on Sunday. After hike, CNG is priced at ₹73.61 per kg in Delhi, ₹76.17 per kg in Noida and ₹81.94 in Gurugram. Prices were also hiked in other parts of country.

110.title: Mumbai reports 151 new COVID cases, highest in Maharashtra
110.article_body: Mumbai reported 151 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, which was the highest among all cities in Maharashtra. With new cases being reported, the total number of active COVID-19 cases in the city is 857. Mumbai was followed by Pune with 30 new COVID-19 cases. Notably, the state reported 248 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday.

111.title: SUV hits vehicle after its driver 'dozes off' in Noida; 4 injured
111.article_body: Four occupants, including two children aged three and five, of a vehicle were injured after an SUV collided with the former on the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway under the Sector 126 police station jurisdiction on Saturday. The SUV's driver told police that he had "dozed off while driving", Additional DCP (Noida) Ran Vijay Singh said. The police have seized the SUV.

112.title: Former cricketers condole demise of Andrew Symonds
112.article_body: Condoling the demise of former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds, Adam Gilchrist tweeted, "Think of your most loyal, fun, loving friend who would do anything for you. That’s Roy." Meanwhile, Shoaib Akhtar wrote, "Devastated to hear about Andrew Symonds passing away...We shared a great relationship on & off the field." Michael Vaughan wrote, "This doesn't feel real."

113.title: Leopard rescued in Pune's Khed amid animal-human conflict incidents
113.article_body: A leopard was rescued in a 10-hour long operation by forest department and Wildlife SOS from Pune's Khed, following incidents of animal-human conflict in the area. "[Team was] able to track...leopard in a record-breaking time of about a day," Wildlife SOS veterinary officer Dr Nikhil Bangar said. Three women were injured in separate leopard attack incidents in Khed this week.

114.title: That's why KKR pay him a hefty paycheck: Sehwag on Russell's performance vs SRH
114.article_body: Praising KKR all-rounder Andre Russell for his performance against SRH, former India opener Virender Sehwag said, "Russell has been KKR's top performer. He has contributed with both bat and ball. This is why they pay him a hefty paycheck and retain him every year." Russell remained unbeaten on 49 off 28 balls and picked three wickets against SRH on Saturday.

115.title: Terrorism in its last phase in J&K, normalcy returning: Union Minister
115.article_body: The three-decade-long terrorism is in its last phase in J&K, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said while adding that normalcy is returning fast in the UT. "The situation in J&K is fast returning to normal but some people and elements consider that their politics will be impacted and hence they resort to such types of acts, directly or indirectly," Singh added.

116.title: B'luru acid attack accused tried escaping, was shot in leg by police: Report
116.article_body: The man, Nagesh Babu, who had attacked a woman with acid after she had rejected his marriage proposal in Bengaluru, was shot in the leg by Bengaluru Police. He was shot after he attacked police constable and tried to escape after his arrest from Tamil Nadu, reports said. Reports added that police inspector fired at him after several warnings.

117.title: Will fulfil all commitments: Minister Puri on G7's criticism over India's wheat export ban
117.article_body: After the Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations criticised India's decision to halt wheat exports, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted, "Wheat stocks are comfortable." He said, "India, a reliable supplier will fulfil all commitments including needs of neighbours and vulnerable countries." He added, "Decision to restrict wheat exports taken with focus on India's food security."

118.title: 18-yr-old man wearing military gear shoots 10 to death in US supermarket, live-streams it
118.article_body: An 18-year-old gunman opened fire at a supermarket in the US city of Buffalo, killing 10 people and wounding three others. The authorities have described the mass shooting as "racially motivated violent extremism". The attacker had live-streamed the mass shooting on Twitch. Police said he shot at 11 Black victims and two who were white before surrendering to police.

119.title: 22-yr-old Hyd man lives with mother's decomposed body for 3 days, detained
119.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who is said to be mentally unsound, was found living with his deceased mother's decomposed body for three days. The neighbours suspect the man murdered his mother as there used to be frequent fights between the two. Police sent the body for autopsy and detained man for questioning. A case of death under suspicious circumstances was registered.

120.title: Former Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds passes away in car accident aged 46
120.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds passed away in a car accident aged 46 on Saturday night. Symonds was involved in a single-vehicle accident, as per the police. "Emergency services attempted to revive the 46-year-old driver and sole occupant, however, he died of his injuries," the police said. Symonds is survived by wife Laura and children Chloe and Billy.

121.title: Liverpool defeat Chelsea 6-5 on penalties to win FA Cup for the 8th time
121.article_body: Liverpool defeated Chelsea 6-5 on penalties in the final to win the FA Cup title for the eighth time. Chelsea have finished runners-up in the FA Cup for the third straight time. This was Liverpool's second trophy of the season. They had defeated Chelsea 11-10 on penalties in the final of the League Cup in February.

122.title: Massive fire at plastic factory in Delhi's Narela, 15 fire tenders reach spot
122.article_body: At least 15 fire tenders have been pressed into service to douse a massive fire that has broken out at a plastic granulation factory in Delhi's Narela. No one is trapped in the factory as per initial information, the Department of Delhi Fire Services has said. A massive blaze inside a 3-storey building in Mundka on Friday killed 27 people.

123.title: KKR defeat SRH by 54 runs, stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race
123.article_body: KKR defeated SRH by 54 runs in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. With the win, KKR are still in contention for a playoffs spot. KKR are now sixth on the points table with 12 points and a net run-rate (NRR) of +0.160. Andre Russell top-scored for KKR with 49*(28) and took three wickets in the match.

124.title: Telangana CM wants to turn the state into West Bengal: Amit Shah
124.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, saying he wants to 'turn Telangana into West Bengal'. Alleging that BJP workers were being 'killed in broad daylight', Shah during his Telangana visit said, "We will ensure that the persons who killed Sai Ganesh (BJP worker) will be dragged to justice and put behind bars."

125.title: 4 killed, 10 injured as speeding bus hits bike & overturns in UP
125.article_body: At least four people were killed and 10 others were injured after a speeding bus hit a bike and overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi. "A speeding private bus hit the bike coming from the opposite side and fell into a ditch after losing control," ASP Anil Kumar Yadav said. The injured are being treated at Community Health Centre, he added.

126.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints 4 new Cabinet ministers amid crisis
126.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa swore in four new Cabinet ministers on Saturday, two days after Ranil Wickremesinghe was appointed as Sri Lanka's new PM. The appointments are part of efforts to ensure stability until a full Cabinet is formed. Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned as the PM on Monday over his handling of the economic crisis in the country.

127.title: Looking at Punjab situation, BJP will soon form govt there: Nadda
127.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said that the party would soon form the government in Punjab. "Looking at the results of Punjab and the current situation here, I can say that in the coming times, BJP government will be formed in the state," JP Nadda said. His comment came after an RPG attack on Punjab Police's intelligence unit in Mohali.

128.title: Where is the promised peace?: Omar Abdullah to govt on Article 370
128.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and National Conference (NC) leader Omar Abdullah criticised the Centre and questioned it over the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. He said, "They (BJP) said if we remove Article 370, there would be peace. I don't see it." Youth are still 'being misled and are picking up guns', Abdullah said.

129.title: I've blocked numbers of those in establishment: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan
129.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday claimed that he is receiving messages from the establishment in the country, but he has blocked their numbers. "I will not talk to anyone unless the date of the next general election is announced," he said. Khan was ousted in a no-trust vote in the Parliament last month.

130.title: 'Lost' Picasso painting seen in Philippines' ex-1st Lady's home as son wins polls
130.article_body: A Pablo Picasso painting, that was thought to have been lost, has reportedly been spotted hanging inside the home of the Philippines' former First Lady Imelda Marcos. Pictures and footage have shown Femme Couche VI (Reclining Woman VI) or its replica hanging on Imelda's wall, as she congratulates her son Ferdinand 'Bongbong' Marcos on being elected as the Philippines' President.

131.title: Mob beats up vehicle driver for running over 6-yr-old; throw him into burning vehicle in MP
131.article_body: A mob on Friday set a vehicle on fire and threw the driver into the fire after beating him up for fatally running over a 6-year-old girl accidentally in Madhya Pradesh, police said. "He sustained severe burn wounds and was rushed...for advanced health care, but...died on Saturday," an official stated. A case has been registered against unidentified people.

132.title: There's a plan to kill me, I've recorded a video & kept it in secret place: Imran Khan
132.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan has claimed that a plan is being hatched to kill him. "I have recorded a video and kept it in a secret place. It will be released if something happens to me. It has names of everyone involved in the conspiracy," Khan said at a rally. He was ousted as Pakistan PM last month.

133.title: He's as frustrated as anyone: Hesson on Kohli's form in IPL 2022
133.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's dismissal on 20(14) against PBKS in IPL 2022, RCB Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said the opener was unfortunate as he looked in good touch. "Virat is as frustrated as anyone but we know that the epic one is around the corner," he added. Kohli has scored 236 runs with one half-century in 13 matches so far.

134.title: KKR may not feel the absence of Pat Cummins: Jaffer
134.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said KKR might not feel the absence of all-rounder Pat Cummins as Tim Southee and Andre Russell have been bowling well, and Umesh Yadav has returned against SRH. Cummins was ruled out of remainder of IPL 2022 due to hip injury. With five wins from 12 matches, KKR are currently eighth on the points table.

135.title: Russell becomes fastest batter in terms of balls faced to reach 2,000 IPL runs
135.article_body: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell has become the fastest batter in terms of balls faced to reach 2,000 runs in IPL history. The 34-year-old took 1,120 deliveries to reach the 2,000-run mark. The previous record was held by Virender Sehwag, who had taken 1,211 deliveries. Russell has scored 2,030 runs in 1,133 deliveries in IPL.

136.title: Our partnership will continue to deepen: PM Modi to UAE's new Prez
136.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday extended his best wishes to Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan after he was elected as UAE's new President. "I'm confident that under his dynamic and visionary leadership, our Comprehensive Strategic Partnership will continue to deepen," he said. This comes after UAE's President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan passed away aged 73 on Friday.

137.title: Regret doing many multi-starrers, I was passionate & foolish: Zayed
137.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan has said that he regrets doing many multi-starrer films, adding that a lot of his near and dear ones told him not to do them. "I was very passionate and very...foolish also," the actor added. He further said that there is regret and a big cost of doing them but it sharpened him and he learnt something.

138.title: Netflix not the best place for you if you can't support our content: Netflix to staff
138.article_body: Netflix has sent a memo telling its employees that they might have to work on shows that they "perceive to be harmful", as it refuses to "censor specific artists or voices". It added, "We program for a diversity of audiences and tastes...If you'd find it hard to support our content breadth, Netflix may not be the best place for you."

139.title: 700 kg of marijuana worth ₹70 lakh seized from Gujarat's Surat
139.article_body: An official said that the police seized 700 kg of marijuana worth ₹70 lakh from a truck in Gujarat's Surat. Acting on secret information, a team of Surat Police seized a truck that was parked behind a motel on a national highway towards Mumbai, the official said. "We believe that the vehicle was carrying marijuana from Odisha," the official added.

140.title: Finland's NATO membership would harm ties with Russia, warns Putin
140.article_body: Finland abandoning the traditional policy of military neutrality to join NATO would be a mistake, Russian President Vladimir Putin told his Finnish counterpart Sauli Niinistö on Saturday. The move could also negatively impact the ties between the two countries, he added. The conversation during a phone call by Niinistö to Putin comes ahead of Finland's membership application to NATO.

141.title: Mira and I consciously don't post pics of kids Misha, Zain: Shahid
141.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor stated that he and his wife Mira Rajput consciously don't post pictures of their children Misha and Zain on social media. He added, "There's just one pic of Zain that I have put out...since he was born, maybe two." He further said that the children have just about reached the age to become aware of his fame.

142.title: BJP bosses fed up with his incompetence: TMC as Biplab Deb quits
142.article_body: After Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb resigned from his position, the Trinamool Congress criticised him saying even the top BJP bosses are "fed up with his incompetence". "Goodbye and good riddance to the CM who failed thousands of people in Tripura!" TMC tweeted. Biplab Deb who resigned today said it was to strengthen the BJP's base in Tripura.

143.title: Will you arrest Owaisi for threatening Hindus?: BJP MLA to Maha CM
143.article_body: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane criticised the Maharashtra government and questioned Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray if he would arrest Akbaruddin Owaisi for "hailing Aurangzeb and threatening Hindus" in the state. In his tweet, Rane also expressed concerns over farmers' plight and unemployment in Maharashtra. Rane's remarks came ahead of the CM's public rally in Mumbai.

144.title: We wasted 25 years due to alliance with BJP, they're worst: Uddhav
144.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said, "We wasted our 25 years due to an alliance with BJP, they're the worst." He said, "The fake 'Hindutva' party...has taken the country to hell." On the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat, Thackeray said, "Bhat was killed by terrorists...in J&K, now what will you (BJP) do? Will you read Hanuman Chalisa there?"

145.title: SRK asked me before 'Main Hoon Na', 'Can you act?': Zayed Khan
145.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan has revealed that he landed 2004 film 'Main Hoon Na' after pursuing Farah Khan to choreograph a song for his 2003 film 'Chura Liyaa Hai Tumne'. "In walks Shah Rukh Khan. Very magnanimous and lovely gentleman. He...said...'But bhai ek baat bata, tujhe acting aati hai na (Tell me something, you know how to act, right)?'" Zayed said.

146.title: India major focus of France's Presidency of EU: French envoy
146.article_body: The French Ambassador to India, Emmanuel Lenain, has said that India is a major focus of France's Presidency of the European Union (EU). Deepening political relations between India and the EU should go hand-in-hand with greater people-to-people ties, he added. Lenain also called for "greater academic mobility" between India and the EU.

147.title: Akshay Kumar tests positive for COVID-19
147.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to social media on Saturday to share that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "Was really looking forward to rooting for our cinema at the India Pavilion at #Cannes2022, but have sadly tested positive for Covid," he wrote. "Will rest it out. Loads of best wishes to you and your entire team, @ianuragthakur," Akshay added.

148.title: Taliban denies reports of ban on men & women eating together at restaurants in Afghan city
148.article_body: Taliban spokesperson Suhail Shaheen refuted reports regarding the Taliban ban on men and women from dining out together at restaurants in Afghan city of Herat. "These are rumours and are not true but part of baseless propaganda," he tweeted. Reports previously quoted a Taliban official as saying authorities "have instructed that men and women be segregated in restaurants".

149.title: 'Blood Moon' lunar eclipse to occur on May 15 & 16; to be visible in US, Europe
149.article_body: The first lunar eclipse of 2022 will be a 'Blood Moon' total lunar eclipse and it will occur on Sunday and Monday (May 15, 16). The Moon is expected to take on a reddish hue and it will pass through the darkest part of Earth's shadow called the Umbra. It'll be visible in Africa, Europe, North America and South America.

150.title: Priyanka most popular face, should take over as Cong chief: Pramod
150.article_body: Congress leader Acharya Pramod Krishnam on Saturday said that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra is the "most popular face of the party", adding that she should take over as the Congress president if Rahul Gandhi is unwilling to lead. Speaking at the party's 'Nav Sankalp Chintan Shivir', Krishnam demanded that the younger generation should be allowed to lead Congress from the front.

151.title: Was determined not to give up despite injury in Thomas Cup semis: Prannoy
151.article_body: HS Prannoy, who won the decisive fifth match after India and Denmark were tied 2-2 in 2022 Thomas Cup semi-final, said the 3-2 win was a "big" one since Denmark's strength lies in singles. Prannoy added that he was determined to not give up despite suffering an ankle injury during the match. Notably, it's India's first-ever final in tournament's history.

152.title: KKR's Rinku forgets to make T sign for DRS, asked by umpire to walk off; video goes viral
152.article_body: KKR batter Rinku Singh forgot to make a T sign for DRS after being given LBW out by on-field umpire on the bowling of SRH's T Natarajan. Rinku was seen chatting with his teammate Sam Billings while waiting for umpires to check with third umpire. However, the umpire asked him to walk off as DRS timer came down to zero.

153.title: Cong plans 50% quota for SC, ST, OBCs & minorities in party posts
153.article_body: The Congress on Saturday said it's planning to give 50% representation to SCs, STs, OBCs and minorities at all levels in the organisation. "At a national policy level, we want a caste-based census to be taken up...In the Women's Reservation Bill, we want a provision for women belonging to SC and ST [communities]," Congress leader K Raju said.

154.title: World no. 1 Swiatek reaches 5th straight final of 2022 at Italian Open
154.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek defeated third-seeded Aryna Sabalenka 6-2, 6-1 in the semi-final of Italian Open to reach her fifth consecutive WTA Tour final on Saturday. The 20-year-old has extended her winning streak to 27 matches, the fourth longest of the century. Swiatek has won titles in Doha, Indian Wells, Miami and Stuttgart in 2022 so far.

155.title: Women's IPL will help the game grow: NZ Women all-rounder Bates
155.article_body: New Zealand Women all-rounder Suzie Bates said that a potential women's edition of Indian Premier League will help the sport grow as a whole, adding it's also going to create a lot of depth in Indian women's cricket environment. "Many players across the world who have played international cricket would love to participate in a full IPL competition," Bates added.

156.title: Believe women except Amber, she sh*t in Johnny's bed: Chris Rock
156.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock joked about Amber Heard at a comedy show in London amid her ongoing defamation trial. He said, "Believe all women...except Amber Heard. What the f*ck is she on? She sh*t in his bed...Once you sh*t in someone's bed, you just guilty of everything." Johnny Depp filed the case against Amber following her claim of surviving domestic abuse.

157.title: Police team looking for missing woman attacked in MP, 3 injured
157.article_body: A police team was attacked and a rifle was snatched from them in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar on Saturday. The incident took place when the team had reached the village after getting information about a woman who went missing with her child, Dhar SP said. Three policemen sustained injuries in the incident and six accused have been identified.

158.title: Russia stops electricity supply to Finland amid NATO membership bid
158.article_body: Russia has suspended the supply of electricity to Finland, an official for the Finnish grid operator said on Saturday. This comes a day after Russian state-owned utility Inter RAO said that it will stop exporting electricity to Finland, citing problems with payments. Notably, Finland has announced that it plans to apply to join NATO, a move strongly opposed by Russia.

159.title: Kerala is the terrorism hub of the country: BJP MP KJ Alphons
159.article_body: BJP MP KJ Alphons called Kerala the "hub of terrorism" in the country. He said, "SDPI and PFI indoctrinate people towards terrorism, especially recruiting from minorities. Doing it for many years." He criticised the Kerala government, accusing it of promoting these outfits. His comment came a day after the Kerala High Court observed that SDPI and PFI were "extremist organisations".

160.title: Will decide when to attend WEF's annual meet in Davos: K'taka CM
160.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said he will decide when he will visit Davos to attend the World Economic Forum's Annual Meeting. "It's an important event, but as these elections have come now, for how many days I should go, when to go, I'll decide," he said. Bommai and Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy are expected to attend the meeting.

161.title: What's your answer to inflation?: T'gana CM's daughter to Amit Shah
161.article_body: TRS MLC and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter K Kavitha criticised the Centre for its policies towards Telangana and questioned Home Minister Amit Shah about inflation, unemployment and communal riots. She asked when the people of Telangana will get their dues of Finance Commission Grants of over ₹3,000 crore. Her comments came ahead of Amit Shah's visit to Telangana.

162.title: Russian forces withdrawing from around second-largest city: Ukraine
162.article_body: The Ukrainian military on Saturday said that Russian troops are withdrawing from around Ukraine's second-largest city after weeks of heavy bombardment. The Russians are pulling back from Kharkiv and focusing on guarding supply routes, it added. The city had been a key Russian military objective in the early phase of the war, according to a report.

163.title: Actress Ketaki arrested for allegedly insulting Sharad Pawar in Facebook post
163.article_body: The Thane Crime Branch has arrested Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale for allegedly sharing a 'derogatory' Facebook post on NCP chief Sharad Pawar, police said. Chitale allegedly remarked upon Pawar's illness, appearance and voice and claimed that he was corrupt in a Facebook post on Friday. She has been booked under IPC section 500 (defamation) and other relevant sections.

164.title: 26-yr-old man beheads his uncle, walks with his head on street for 2km in MP
164.article_body: Police have arrested a 26-year-old man for allegedly beheading his 60-year-old maternal uncle and walking with his head and an axe for around 2 km in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district. The accused suspected his uncle was creating problems for him by performing black magic on him, police said. He allegedly hit his uncle's neck with an axe following an argument.

165.title: SRH's Umran has the pace but he'll take more time to mature: Shami
165.article_body: Speaking about Umran Malik, GT pacer Mohammad Shami stated the 22-year-old SRH pacer has the pace but he needs more time to mature. "Because with pace, bowlers need to work on accuracy as well," he added. Umran, who clocked the fastest ball of IPL 2022 with a 157 kmph delivery, has been bowling consistently at 150 kmph in the tournament.

166.title: 710 phones recovered from jail inmates in special drive: Punjab CM
166.article_body: Punjab government has so far confiscated 710 mobile phones from jails in a special drive, CM Bhagwant Mann said. He said that these mobile phones were used by the gangsters or smugglers to run their rackets from the jails. The responsibility of the jail's officers and staff who were involved in sneaking in these mobiles will be fixed, he added.

167.title: He's brilliant, a true leader: Hogg on GT captain Hardik
167.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Hardik Pandya has been brilliant as a captain for GT in ongoing IPL, adding he's a true leader. Hogg further said that the all-rounder has got a great foundation and he is just going to grow with the right people around him. Hardik-led GT are the first team to qualify for playoffs.

168.title: Gupkar alliance to meet J&K LG over security of Kashmiri Pandits
168.article_body: The People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD) has sought an appointment with J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha to discuss the issue of safety of Kashmiri Pandits in the valley, PAGD's spokesperson MY Tarigami said. This comes after a Kashmiri Pandit, Rahul Bhat, was killed by terrorists in J&K on Thursday. Tarigami said the death of Bhat has shaken the valley.

169.title: Haven't been part of scripted reality shows, talent can't be faked: Shaan
169.article_body: Singer Shaan stated that he hasn't been a part of reality shows that were scripted, adding that if such situations arrived, he disagreed to be part of them. "If people [enjoy scripted shows], that means they're loving...fake things only," Shaan added. He further said the one thing that you cannot fake is talent and the singing will always be genuine.

170.title: House of poacher involved in MP policemen's killing bulldozed, his body found
170.article_body: The administration in Madhya Pradesh's Guna on Saturday bulldozed the house of one of the blackbuck poachers who were accused of killing three policemen on Friday. At the house, police also found the body of the accused, identified as Naushad Mewati, who was killed during cross-firing. Police are currently searching for the remaining accused, who are absconding, as per reports.

171.title: Nawazuddin's 'No Land's Man' selected at Sydney Film Festival
171.article_body: American-Bangladeshi-Indian drama film 'No Land's Man' starring Nawazuddin Siddiqui has been officially selected at the Sydney Film Festival. The actor took to social media to make the announcement on Friday, writing, "The film close to my heart is travelling the world." The film was earlier nominated for the Kim Jiseok Award at the Busan International Film Festival.

172.title: Sundar's absence has hurt SRH in IPL 2022: Harbhajan
172.article_body: Talking about SRH all-rounder Washington Sundar, who hasn't played in his side's last two matches in ongoing IPL, Harbhajan Singh said his absence has hurt SRH. "He can bowl with the new ball and take wickets. He also provides a cushion with...bat. In his absence, they haven't found that comfort," he added. SRH are currently seventh in the standings.

173.title: Neha Kakkar's husband Rohanpreet Singh's cash, diamond ring stolen from Himachal hotel
173.article_body: Singer Neha Kakkar's husband and Punjabi singer Rohanpreet Singh's personal belongings including a diamond ring and cash were stolen at a hotel in Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, said a police official on Saturday. His iPhone and smartwatch were also stolen from the hotel, the official added. Police took cognisance of the matter and registered a case.

174.title: Neena Gupta, director thought I couldn't act: Amit on 'Kyun Hota...'
174.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh, who made his acting debut with television show 'Kyun Hota Hai Pyarrr', has revealed that producer-actress Neena Gupta and director Nupur Asthana felt he "was so bad and didn't know how to act". Amit added, "I took 40-50 retakes and gave a very bad shot...But then they discussed that there's something in my eyes...so I should stay."

175.title: One of those days: PBKS' Bairstow on his 29-ball 66 against RCB
175.article_body: PBKS opener Jonny Bairstow, who hit a 29-ball 66, including four fours and seven sixes against RCB in IPL 2022, said, "It's one of those days. A couple of those come off and it's your day." Bairstow and Liam Livingstone(70) guided PBKS to 209/9 in 20 overs. Bairstow was adjudged Player of the Match in PBKS' 54-run win over RCB.

176.title: 17-year-old boy killed as bomb explodes in garbage dump in Bengal
176.article_body: A 17-year-old boy died on Saturday morning when a bomb exploded in a garbage dump in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas, police said.
