The boy's father had found the container while clearing the garbage dump. The bomb, which was inside a container, exploded when the boy took it from his father and threw it at a lamppost, police added.

177.title: Shah Rukh Khan was my senior in college, I used his notes to study: Kabir Khan
177.article_body: Recalling memories of his college days, director Kabir Khan told Mashable India he used Shah Rukh Khan's notes in college. He said, "I was doing Masters in Communication which was basically a filmmaking course. Before me, the most famous person from our institute was Shah Rukh." "He was my senior in MCRC. I used his notes to study," Kabir added.

178.title: KKR to bat first against SRH, make 2 changes to their playing XI
178.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bat first against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. KKR have made two changes to their playing XI, with Umesh Yadav and Sam Billings replacing Pat Cummins and Sheldon Jackson. SRH have included Washington Sundar, Marco Jansen and T Natarajan in their playing XI.

179.title: G7 nations criticise India's decision to stop exporting wheat: Germany
179.article_body: The Group of Seven (G7) nations (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, UK, US) condemn India's decision to halt wheat exports, German Agriculture Minister Cem Ozdemir said. Addressing a press conference on Saturday, Ozdemir said, "If everyone starts to impose export restrictions or close markets, that would worsen the crisis." The government said export is banned to protect our food security.

180.title: India never had and never will have any Muslim vote bank: Owaisi
180.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday said India never had and will never have any Muslim vote bank. "Muslims cannot change a regime in the country. You have been misled," he said. "Instead of Babri Masjid...now the Gyanvapi issue has cropped up," Owaisi said, while referring to Varanasi court allowing the survey of the Gyanvapi mosque.

181.title: Anil Kapoor's passion for cinema is unmatched: Thar's Sanjay Bishnoi
181.article_body: 'Thar' actor Sanjay Bishnoi has said that Anil Kapoor's enthusiasm and passion for cinema are unmatched. "Sadly my character doesn't meet Anil...in the film but it was a dream come true for me to be part of [it] and meet him in person," the actor added. He further said that Anil's son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has deep knowledge of cinema.

182.title: Green Pune Movement urges Pawar to scrap Vetal hill tunnel project
182.article_body: The Green Pune Movement, which includes citizen groups and environmentalists, has urged NCP chief Sharad Pawar to get the tunnel project at Vetal hill cancelled. Pawar has held two meetings with residents, environmentalists and PMC officials over the issue so far. Residents and environmentalists fear the tunnel across the hill will damage the ecology, a member of the movement said.

183.title: Contaminated water from Punjab reaching Raj via Bikaner canal: BJP
183.article_body: The BJP's Rajasthan unit on Friday wrote to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann about the issue of contaminated water reaching their state from Punjab and demanded a permanent solution. "Many Rajasthan districts get their water supply from...Bikaner canal...Industrial effluents get mixed in the water in Punjab's Ludhiana," Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha spokesperson Rajat Swami said.

184.title: Rachakonda Police avert child marriage, minor girl rescued
184.article_body: The She Team of Rachakonda Police averted a child marriage in the Shaheen Nagar area of Balapur and rescued a minor girl. They also counselled the parents about the consequences of child marriage. Officials say that at least 100 child marriages have been prevented in the last four years by the Rachakonda Police Commissionerate.

185.title: Manik Saha chosen as next Chief Minister of Tripura
185.article_body: Tripura BJP President and Rajya Sabha MP Dr Manik Saha has been chosen as the head of the state party legislature and will take over as CM from Biplab Kumar Deb. This came after Deb submitted his resignation to Tripura Governor Satyadeo Narain Arya in Agartala on Saturday. Deb said he'll work to ensure BJP's win in 2023 state polls.

186.title: Navneet Rana & her husband recite Hanuman Chalisa at Delhi temple
186.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana on Saturday recited the Hanuman Chalisa and performed a "maha aarti" at the Hanuman temple in Delhi's Connaught Place. Speaking to reporters later, Navneet Rana said, "Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray is the biggest danger looming over Maharashtra. I have come to offer prayers to rid Maharashtra of this danger."

187.title: Rising bread prices triggers protests across Iran
187.article_body: The rising prices of bread in Iran have triggered protests against the government across the country, according to reports. Notably, the government had cut subsidies for imported wheat causing price hikes as high as 300% for a variety of flour-based staples. Security forces responded with force against the protesters and arrested scores of "provocateurs".

188.title: Govt lists 3 reasons for ban on wheat exports
188.article_body: After government banned wheat export, Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam listed 3 reasons. "Reason for ban is to protect...food security of our citizens, ensure adequate food supply to...public distribution system and ensure that we're able to direct food supplies to vulnerable food-deficit countries," he said. "There's no dramatic fall in production, also no need to imagine shortage," he added.

189.title: Hyderabad Police arrest chain snatcher, recover jewellery
189.article_body: In a joint operation, the Hyderabad Special Zonal Crime team and Eluru Police arrested an inter-state chain snatcher, identified as Angadi Suresh, from his residence in Hyderabad. The police said that they recovered 15 tolas of gold jewellery from Suresh's possession. The accused is involved in 140 property offence cases in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, they added.

190.title: COVID-19 a great turmoil to fall on N Korea since its founding: Kim Jong-un
190.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said the spread of coronavirus is a "great turmoil" to fall on the country since its founding, state media reported. "But if we don't lose focus in implementing epidemic policy and maintain strong organisation power and control based on single-minded unity of the party and the people...we can more than overcome the crisis," he added.

191.title: India abstains from voting on UN rights body resolution on Ukraine
191.article_body: India has abstained from voting on a resolution of the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) that seeks to address the "deteriorating human rights situation in Ukraine stemming from the Russian aggression". Eleven other countries, including Pakistan and Venezuela, also abstained from voting, while China and Eritrea voted against it. The resolution was adopted after 33 countries voted in its favour.

192.title: Dropping atomic bomb on Pak is better than giving power to thieves: Imran Khan
192.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Friday said, "Dropping an atomic bomb (on Pakistan) would have been better than handing over the helm to the thieves." He reportedly made the remarks while addressing reporters at his Banigala residence. Khan, who was ousted after losing a no-confidence motion, said he was 'shocked to see thieves being foisted' on Pakistan.

193.title: Video captures the moment people jumped from burning Delhi building
193.article_body: A video showing people jumping from a four-storey building to escape the fire that killed at least 27 people in Delhi's Mundka has surfaced online. The video also shows people getting onto a crane to escape. The fire reportedly broke out on the first floor of the building, with Delhi police claiming that the building didn't have fire safety clearance.

194.title: Delhi likely to see severe heatwave conditions tomorrow: IMD
194.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted that Delhi is likely to witness severe heatwave conditions on May 15. According to the IMD, the national capital is witnessing above normal temperatures ranging from 40 to 46 degrees Celsius. Meanwhile, amid the heatwave conditions, Delhi's peak power demand rose to 6,572 MW on Wednesday, the highest ever in the month of May.

195.title: 47-ft-long sperm whale found dead off US coast with plastic bags in stomach
195.article_body: A 47-foot-long sperm whale was found dead off the coast of US' Florida, with experts saying it had a huge tangle of plastic bags in its stomach. Biologists at Fish and Wildlife Research Institute conducted an autopsy on the whale. Experts said the waste in its stomach "likely did not allow the whale to eat properly".

196.title: Russia advises citizens to avoid travel to UK
196.article_body: Russia has advised its citizens to avoid travelling to the UK, complaining that British authorities were making it "virtually impossible" for Russians to obtain visas. Russian Foreign Ministry alleged that the UK was prioritising applications from Ukrainian refugees over those of Russians. UK's actions are "a politically motivated infringement of the rights of Russian citizens," the ministry said.

197.title: IPL betting network influenced results in 2019 with inputs from Pak: CBI
197.article_body: Reliable information has been received about a network of individuals involved in IPL betting in India, the CBI said on Saturday. The agency filed an FIR in the matter, which said the network 'influenced' IPL results in 2019 with inputs received from Pakistan. Three people (one from Delhi and two from Hyderabad) have been booked in the case, officials said.

198.title: SIT formed to probe lynching of 2 tribals in MP over cow slaughter
198.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) was formed on Saturday to investigate the deaths of two tribal men, who were allegedly lynched by 15-20 men in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni earlier this month. Police said the incident took place when the accused caught the duo with cow meat. "Instead of informing the police, they took action on their own," Seoni SP said.

199.title: Sushant used to sleep for 2 hrs, believed humans need only 2 hrs of sleep: Kiara
199.article_body: Kiara Advani, who shared screen space with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput in 'M.S. Dhoni: The Untold Story', has said she found it "fascinating" that Sushant used to sleep only for two hours and still used to show up on the set the next day "energised". He believed that the human body only needs two hours of sleep, Kiara added.

200.title: Twitter user calls Madhavan promoting 'Jayeshbhai...' disappointing, he reacts
200.article_body: After R Madhavan praised Ranveer Singh's latest film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' on Twitter, a user wrote, "When you promote such trashy movies it makes you lose your credibility...Disappointing." Responding to the user, Madhavan wrote, "I'll lose credibility because I liked...film that you may not have? You could've...politely disagreed with me. I find it hard to value the credibility you talk of."

201.title: Be kind, giving as an actor: SRK to daughter Suhana ahead of debut
201.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan on Saturday shared a note for his daughter Suhana Khan on social media after the first poster of her debut film 'The Archies' was released. Shah Rukh wrote, "Be kind and giving as an actor. The brickbats and applause [are] not yours to keep...The road to [people's hearts] is unending...Signed Another Actor."

202.title: After 27 changes in KKR, hope they don't make too many now: Harbhajan
202.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said KKR need to win against SRH to have a chance of making the playoffs in the ongoing IPL. He added that team selection is important for today's match. "They have made 27 changes so far. I hope they do not make too many changes now and...one thing that changes is the result," he further said.

203.title: Woman disguised herself as man for 30 yrs to raise daughter in TN, pics surface
203.article_body: A woman from Tamil Nadu disguised herself as a man for 30 years to raise her daughter singlehandedly. Three decades ago, Pechiyammal, 20, lost her husband to a heart attack 15 days after their wedding. After she gave birth to a girl, Pechiyammal faced harassment. To raise her daughter without remarrying, Pechiyammal decided to disguise herself as a man.

204.title: Naturopathy institute to set up referral centre at Pune's SPPU
204.article_body: Pune-based National Institute of Naturopathy will set up a referral centre at the campus of the Savitribai Phule Pune University (SSPU), according to a report. This comes after the naturopathy institute inked a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the university. Together with the university, the institute will promote teaching and research in naturopathy and yogic sciences.

205.title: 2.8 kg of gold stolen from SBI locker in Bihar, 1 held, 2 employees suspended
205.article_body: A contractual worker of the State Bank of India was arrested after 2.8 kg of gold worth ₹1.25 crore was stolen from the bank's Baijnathpur branch in Bihar. "It is beyond imagination how...keys to the locker were handed over to a contractual employee...cashier and...accountant were responsible for keeping the keys," police said. The two bank employees have been suspended.

206.title: Massive fire breaks out at Amritsar hospital, patients evacuated
206.article_body: A massive fire broke out in the Guru Nanak Dev Hospital in Punjab's Amritsar on Saturday. "Initially, the fire broke out in transformers. Eight fire tenders reached the spot. The fire is under control," a fire officer said. The patients admitted in different wards of the building were reportedly evacuated by hospital employees. No injuries have been reported so far.

207.title: There should be 1 language in all states: Sanjay Raut amid language row
207.article_body: Amid the language row, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday pitched for "one nation, one language". "Union Home Minister Amit Shah should accept this challenge that there should be one language in all states. One country, one Constitution, one nishan (emblem) and one language should be there," Raut said. Hindi is spoken across India and has acceptability, he added.

208.title: SpaceX launches 53 Starlink satellites, aims to launch 53 more today
208.article_body: SpaceX launched a batch of 53 Starlink satellites on Friday on a Falcon 9 first stage booster. It is aiming to launch another batch of 53 satellites on Saturday, at the earliest, or Sunday. Earlier this week, SpaceX released a map showing the Starlink service's availability in 32 nations. The service is expected to come to India "soon", it showed.

209.title: We're not feeling safe here: Protesting Kashmiri Pandits in Srinagar
209.article_body: Kashmiri Pandits on Saturday staged protest in Srinagar against the targeted killing of government employee Rahul Bhat. "We want safety...we're not feeling safe here," one of the protestors said. "Move us where we can feel safe, we can go anywhere. Nothing has been done for us," he added. Bhat was shot dead by terrorists within his office premises on Thursday.

210.title: Arrested factory owners' father also dies in Delhi's Mundka fire
210.article_body: The father of the two factory owners arrested in connection to the fire that broke out in a building in Mundka also died in the same mishap. Their father was taking part in a motivational session at the factory located on the first floor when the fire started. As per the authorities, the building was operating without a Fire NOC.

211.title: Was upset when Tiger announced 'Rambo' remake, I wanted to do it: Ranveer
211.article_body: Ranveer Singh in a recent interview said he was very upset after Tiger Shroff bagged the Indian remake of Sylvester Stallone-starrer Hollywood classic 'Rambo'. "I was like 'ye to mujhe karna tha'. That's my default," he added. "I started off watching Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sylvester Stallone. These are my guys...I loved films like Rambo, these are my heroes," Ranveer said.

212.title: Unidentified man found dead in graffiti-covered car in B'luru
212.article_body: An unidentified man was found dead on the front seat of a graffiti-covered ambassador car that had been parked on the streets of Rajajinagar in Bengaluru for over two years, reports said. The body was reportedly discovered on Friday after residents complained of a foul smell coming from the car. He is suspected to have died from consuming excess alcohol.

213.title: UNSC calls for transparent probe in Al Jazeera journalist's killing
213.article_body: The UN Security Council condemned the killing of Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh and called for an "immediate, thorough and transparent" probe into her death. The move followed an outcry on Friday after Israeli police clashed with Palestinian mourners at Abu Akleh's funeral. The 51-year-old was shot during an Israeli military raid in the West Bank on Wednesday.

214.title: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb resigns a year ahead of Assembly polls
214.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Saturday submitted his resignation from the top post to the state's Governor Satyadeo Narain Arya. As per reports, BJP's legislative party meeting will take place at 5 pm today to choose the next state Chief Minister. The state is scheduled to go to polls in 2023.

215.title: He is worth his weight in gold: Sidhu as Jakhar quits Congress
215.article_body: After Sunil Jakhar quit the Congress on Saturday, party leader Navjot Singh Sidhu said that the Congress "should not lose" the former. He added that former Punjab Congress chief Jakhar is "an asset worth his weight in gold, any differences can be resolved on the table". Congress leaders "sitting in Delhi ruined the party in Punjab," Jakhar had said.

216.title: India to supply 65,000 metric tonnes of urea to Sri Lanka amid crisis
216.article_body: Sri Lanka is set to receive 65,000 metric tonnes of urea from India amid the paddy cultivation season. This comes amid a severe economic crisis in the country that has sparked a shortage of essential items. Sri Lanka is aiming to boost its agriculture sector to avoid any disruption following the drop in paddy cultivation during the previous season.

217.title: Bride’s mother objects to 2 men dancing in wedding, stabbed to death in Odisha
217.article_body: The 50-year-old mother of a bride in Odisha's Bargarh was allegedly stabbed to death by two of her neighbours for objecting to their dancing in the wedding procession. The accused reportedly joined the bridegroom's procession and started creating trouble. When the woman requested them not to do so, they flew into a rage and attacked her, police said.

218.title: Chhattisgarh board declares Class 10, 12 results; Kunti Sao tops 12th
218.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Board of Secondary Education (CGBSE) announced the Class 10 and 12 examination results on Saturday. Kunti Sao from Raigarh has topped Class 12 by securing 98.20% marks. Two Class 10 toppers, Suman Patel and Sonali Bala, have secured 98.67% marks. Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel earlier announced that top 10 meritorious students will be rewarded with a helicopter ride.

219.title: Assam CM hands over appointment letters to 22,958 new recruits
219.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma handed over appointment letters to 22,958 new recruits in 11 state government departments on Saturday. He called it a "momentous occasion" and said that we are on course to redeem our pledge to provide 1 lakh jobs to youth of Assam. "We shall soon recruit another batch of 7,000-8,000 youth," Sarma said during the event.

220.title: Treat Anil Deshmukh at govt, not private hospital: Mumbai court
220.article_body: A Mumbai court rejected former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's plea to be shifted to a private hospital. It added that Deshmukh should be sent to a civic body-run hospital for a test and then shifted to JJ Hospital for further treatment. Deshmukh dislocated a shoulder last month at Arthur Road Jail, where he has been lodged since November 2021.

221.title: Samsung in talks to hike chipmaking prices by up to 20%: Report
221.article_body: Samsung Electronics is in talks with its clients about hiking prices for chip manufacturing deals by up to 20% this year, Bloomberg reported. It has completed negotiations with some clients while still in discussions with others. Contract-based chip prices are likely to rise around 15% to 20%, depending upon the level of sophistication.

222.title: Man beats, shaves wife's head over 'extra salt' in food in Gujarat
222.article_body: A case has been filed after a man allegedly shaved his wife's head and beat her for putting "extra salt" in the food in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The wife claimed that while the accused was beating her, she told him that she'd approach police if he didn't leave, following which he grabbed a razor and "mercilessly" began to shave her head.

223.title: Severe heatwave in 7 states/UTs, temperature ranging from 40-46°C: IMD
223.article_body: IMD's Director General of Meteorology Mrutyunjay Mohapatra on Saturday said severe heatwave is prevailing in Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and Vidarbha (region in Maharashtra). "Temperatures are ranging from 40-46°C, which is above normal temperature," he added. He also stated that red and orange warnings have been issued for parts of Rajasthan, MP and Haryana.

224.title: We were amazed, amused your 1st word is 'Tiger': Dia on son's 1st b'day
224.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza shared a picture of her son Avyaan Azaad on social media on Saturday to celebrate his first birthday. The actress revealed in the caption that her son was born premature and suffered from necrotising enterocolitis, which needed two surgeries. She further wrote, "We are amazed and amused that your first spoken word is Tiger."

225.title: Father, son steal electricity worth ₹5.93 crore in Thane, booked
225.article_body: A father-son duo has been booked for allegedly stealing 34,09,901 units of electricity, worth ₹5.93 crore, in Thane district, an official said. "Power was being stolen remotely with the use of a gadget that was tampering [with]...meter readings," he said. The theft came to light after Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited's team raided a stone crushing unit in Falegaon.

226.title: Gold worth ₹1 crore hidden in underwear seized at B'luru airport
226.article_body: The Customs officials at Bengaluru airport have seized 2.843 kilograms of gold, estimated to be worth more than ₹1 crore, from two passengers who had arrived from Dubai. As per the officials, the accused were trying to smuggle the gold paste by concealing it in their waistline and underwear. Both the passengers have been arrested and further investigation is launched.

227.title: PFI, SDPI are extremist organisations but are not banned: Kerala HC
227.article_body: Kerala High Court has said that the Popular Front of India (PFI) and its political wing the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) are extremist organisations but they are not banned. The court made the observation while rejecting a petition seeking the transfer of an RSS worker's murder case from the Kerala Police to the Central Bureau of Investigation.

228.title: Unable to sell Sputnik Light stock over Ukraine war, B'luru manufacturer writes to PM
228.article_body: Director of Bengaluru-based manufacturer of COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik Light, wrote to PM Narendra Modi requesting procurement of their doses as they are unable to sell 2.5 crore units due to the Russia-Ukraine war. Notably, DCGI has granted emergency use permission to Sputnik Light. Arun Kumar requested that the government should acquire the available doses failing which they will get wasted.

229.title: US, Russian defence chiefs speak for 1st time since Ukraine's invasion
229.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke with Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Friday for the first time since Ukraine invasion. The hour-long call was at Austin's request, who used the first call between the two in 84 days to urge Shoigu to implement an "immediate ceasefire". Austin also "emphasised the importance of maintaining lines of communication" during the call.

230.title: Balasaheb Thackeray's sister passes away at 84 in Pune
230.article_body: Sanjeevani Karandikar, the younger sister of Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray, passed away at the age of 84 in Pune on Friday. "With her demise, the Thackeray family has lost a motherly figure. We deeply mourn her loss," Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said. Karandikar's last rites were held at the Vaikunth Crematorium in the city.

231.title: 23-yr-old woman, declared 'male' in medical test, wins court case for job in Maharashtra
231.article_body: Bombay High Court directed Maharashtra government to finalise within two months the appointment in the state police department of a 23-year-old woman, who lost out on the post after a medical test declared her a 'male'. "No fault can be found in...petitioner as throughout, she has pursued her career as...female," court said. She had qualified for written and physical tests.

232.title: Rainfall predicted in several states/UTs; IMD releases list
232.article_body: The IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, West Bengal, Sikkim, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura between May 14 and 17. Isolated rainfall is likely over J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand and UP on May 16 and 17. Rainfall also predicted in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Kerala and Lakshadweep over next five days.

233.title: Death toll in Mundka fire incident may rise to 30: Fire official
233.article_body: Rescue operation at the site where a fire broke out near Delhi's Mundka metro station is now over, a fire official said, adding that the death toll in the incident could rise to 30. So far, 27 people have been declared dead. "In the morning we got some more remains [which] seem like bodies of two-three people," an official said.

234.title: B'luru Traffic Police covers 44 km in 39 mins to transport heart
234.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Wednesday covered a distance of 44 kilometres in 39 minutes to transport a live heart from RR Nagar to Narayana Health City in Bommasandra, a report stated. The heart was of a 32-year-old man who was declared brain dead following an accident. The organ was later transplanted into a 36-year-old patient who suffered from Dilated Cardiomyopathy.

235.title: Heavy traffic on Mumbai's Eastern Express Highway as JVLR flyover shut
235.article_body: Heavy traffic is being observed on Mumbai's Eastern Express Highway since morning with long queues of vehicles stretching from Vikhroli to Ghatkopar on the expressway. The jam is due to the closure of the flyover over the junction where JVLR (Jogeshwari-Vikhroli Link Road) merges with the Eastern Expressway. The flyover has been closed for 12 days from May 13-24.

236.title: Just a psychological thing: CSK CEO on Ambati Rayudu deleting 'IPL retirement' tweet
236.article_body: After Ambati Rayudu tweeted that he is retiring from IPL after the ongoing season and deleted the tweet minutes later, CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan said, "I spoke to him and he is not retiring." "He was disappointed with his performance and that's why he might have put out that tweet. Just a psychological thing, I reckon," he added.

237.title: Bring in Finch or Billings in place of Cummins: Sehwag ahead of KKR-SRH match
237.article_body: Ahead of KKR-SRH in IPL 2022, Virender Sehwag said KKR should either play Aaron Finch or Sam Billings in place of Pat Cummins after the Australian was ruled out of the remainder of IPL. "Feel someone like Billings will come into...middle-order if Cummins is replaced by an Indian bowler. They need to strengthen their batting, which isn't working," he added.

238.title: Single-use plastic to be banned in Delhi Secretariat from June 1: Minister
238.article_body: The Environment Minister of Delhi, Gopal Rai, on Saturday announced that single-use plastic products will be banned in Delhi Secretariat from June 1. "Move to be gradually implemented across the national capital," he added. Earlier in February, the Delhi government had asked manufacturers, retailers, shopkeepers and the general public to phase out single-use plastic stocks by June 30, 2022.

239.title: 6 rescued after fire breaks out in residential building in Gurugram
239.article_body: At least six people were rescued in over four hours after a fire broke out in a residential building in Gurugram's Sector 52, officials said. A call about the fire was received around midnight, said a senior fire officer. "Our team reached the spot...Seven fire tenders were pressed into service and the fire was extinguished," the officer added.

240.title: Gyanvapi Mosque video survey resumes amid tight security in Varanasi
240.article_body: The court-ordered video survey of the Gyanvapi Mosque premises in UP's Varanasi resumed on Saturday amid tight security. The survey was suspended earlier as protesters stopped the court-appointed team from entering the mosque located next to the Kashi Vishwanath temple. The survey work was conducted for four hours on Saturday and will continue on Sunday, advocate Sudhir Tripathi said.

241.title: People say working with me will get them boycotted too: Kangana
241.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has revealed in an interview that casting for her films is a very big problem for her. She added that there are several people belonging to a "certain group" who admit that if they are seen with her even during promotions, they will get boycotted from the group. "On every level, it is a challenge," Kangana said.

242.title: Meta, Twitter seek to block Texas media law against certain bans
242.article_body: Meta, Google, Twitter and other tech firms, represented by their lobbying groups, have filed an emergency request with the US Supreme Court seeking to block a Texas law that prohibits the platforms from banning users based on their political views. It also requires them to publicly disclose how they moderate content. The law was successfully blocked in court last year.

243.title: Status of religious places shouldn't be changed: Cong on Gyanvapi mosque case
243.article_body: Speaking about the ongoing videography survey of Gyanvapi mosque, Congress leader P Chidambaram said that status of places of worship should not be changed as it can lead to a "huge conflict". "The Places of Worship Act was passed by Narasimha Rao's government with only exception to Ram Janmabhoomi...All other places of worship should remain as they are," he added.

244.title: Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan elected as new President of UAE
244.article_body: Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan has been elected as the President of UAE by Federal Supreme Council, state news agency WAM reported. This comes after UAE President Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan passed away aged 73. The newly elected President had mourned his demised and said, "We were blessed by your strength, wisdom and leadership."

245.title: Will respond if NATO moves nuclear forces closer to our border: Russia
245.article_body: Russia will respond by taking "adequate precautionary measures" if NATO deploys nuclear forces and infrastructure closer to the country's border, Deputy Foreign Minister Alexander Grushko was quoted saying by Russian news agencies. He added that Moscow has no hostile intentions towards Finland and Sweden and doesn't see "real" reasons for those two nations to be joining the NATO military alliance.

246.title: Cong leader seeks alcohol-free T'gana, says 'mindset getting spoiled'
246.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao has criticised the Telangana government for running liquor shops in the state. "The mindset of the youth aged between 18-20 years is getting spoiled. People of Telangana are becoming alcoholics," he said. "See development in states like Bihar and Gujarat, that are alcohol-free. Why can't our state become like that?" Rao added.

247.title: Big B shares poster of grandson Agastya's debut film, says 'Another SONrise'
247.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter to share the poster of his grandson Agastya Nanda's debut project, titled 'The Archies'. "Another SONrise...my GrandSON...all the blessings Agastya...love you," he wrote. The film, directed by Zoya Akhtar, also marks the debut of Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan and Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor.

248.title: He's leader in the team: PBKS captain Mayank on Arshdeep
248.article_body: Calling teammate Arshdeep Singh a very "energetic and confident" person, PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said the 23-year-old pacer is the leader in the team. "He rallies around everyone, takes up the responsibility, even goes up and speaks to the bowlers sometimes," he added. Arshdeep has taken seven wickets from 12 matches so far in IPL 2022.

249.title: Started Dell with just $1,000 in 1984, made $101 bn in revenue in 2021: CEO
249.article_body: Michael Dell, CEO of Dell Technologies, took to LinkedIn to share a memory of how he started the company. He wrote, "A fun memory from 34 years ago. I started Dell Technologies in 1984 with $1,000 in my...university...dorm room." He added that by 1987, Dell had posted $159 million in revenue and in 2021 its revenue grew to $101 billion.

250.title: Police identify 6 Mundka fire victims' bodies, consider DNA tests
250.article_body: A day after 27 people died in a fire that broke out in Delhi's Mundka, police identified six of the bodies. DCP (Outer district) said, "The identification process is going on." Police have decided to conduct a DNA identification test in case they are not able to ascertain the identity of some of the victims, whose charred bodies were found.

251.title: I'm a farmer's son; don't need flamboyant, luxurious life: Pankaj
251.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has stated that he has never felt the need to pursue a flamboyant lifestyle or a luxurious life. He added, "I am the son of a farmer...we had barely seen any money. My parents didn't even [have] a television." The actor further said that he has grown up understanding "the value and vice" of money.

252.title: Salman starts shooting for 'Kabhi Eid...', shares 1st look from film
252.article_body: Salman Khan took to social media on Saturday to unveil his look for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. "Shooting commences for my new film," he captioned the picture. Directed by Farhad Samji of 'Housefull 4' and 'Bachchhan Paandey' fame, it will also feature Pooja Hegde. The film is slated to release in cinemas on December 30, 2022.

253.title: Contractor to repair Vajpayee stadium's roof in a month: BBMP chief
253.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has said that the contractor will repair the roof of the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium in a month. The stadium's roof collapsed on May 8, months after its inauguration in March. Nath added that BBMP won't "spend a penny" on the repair and the contractor will bear the entire costs.

254.title: Rather than 'chintan', Cong should do 'aatma-chintan': BJP on 'Chintan Shivir'
254.article_body: Reacting to Congress' three-day 'Chintan Shivir' being held in Udaipur, BJP said that Congress should focus on being relevant rather than worrying about the country. "Rather than 'chintan' (brainstorming) about the country, Congress should do 'aatma-chintan' (introspection) about its survival, as the party is totally disconnected from both the ground and the masses," BJP's Anil Baluni said.

255.title: 22-year-old man rapes 10-year-old girl in Gurugram, arrested
255.article_body: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for raping a class 4 girl when she was alone at her home in Gurugram on Wednesday, police said. "When I returned home, my...daughter was weeping. She told...the accused had raped her," the victim's mother said. According to police, the accused lived in the same building where the family of the 10-year-old girl resided.

256.title: Was told people have been sent to hit my unit: Kabir on shooting in Afghanistan
256.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan recalled how he was warned about a death threat 14 days into the shoot of 'Kabul Express' in Afghanistan. "Indian ambassador and Indian military attache...told us...five people have been sent by a unit across...border in Pakistan to hit out at your unit," he said, adding Afghans took it personally and deployed 60 armed commandos for their security.

257.title: Alia shares unseen wedding pics with Ranbir on 1 month anniversary
257.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt on Saturday took to Instagram to share a series of unseen pictures from her wedding after-party and reception with actor Ranbir Kapoor to celebrate their one month anniversary. The couple got married in an intimate ceremony at their residence in Mumbai's Bandra on April 14. Alia had earlier shared pictures from the wedding ceremony on social media.

258.title: Show papers: Shah Jahan's heir on princess' 'Jaipur royals own Taj Mahal land' claim
258.article_body: Prince Yakub Habeebuddin Tucy who claims to be a descendant of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan has "challenged" princess and BJP MP Diya Kumari's claim that the Taj Mahal was built on land owned by Jaipur royals. Calling the claims "idiotic", Tucy said, "If you have even a drop of Rajput blood in you, you'll show the documents (proving land ownership)."

259.title: Putin seen with 'bloated head' in virtual meeting, pics spark rumours of 'cover-up'
259.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin appeared in a virtual meeting with a "bloated head" that looked like it was photoshopped onto his body, commentators claimed. This comes amid opposition claims that Putin is due to have surgery. The pictures sparked rumours of a botched cover-up, with claims that he's prepared to use body doubles to hide his health crisis from public.

260.title: Woman lets 50-yr-old lover rape her minor daughter in Chennai, makes her deliver at home
260.article_body: A 38-year-old woman allowed her 50-year-old lover to rape her own daughter in Chennai. She also made her daughter deliver a baby at home. The girl, who was in class 11, dropped out last year due to pregnancy. The woman reportedly married her off to the man on knowing she was pregnant. The woman and her lover have been arrested.

261.title: An Indian startup is turning unicorn in every 8-10 days: PM Modi
261.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi while virtually launching the Madhya Pradesh Startup Portal on Friday said that today every eight to 10 days a startup is turning a unicorn in India. He said startups in India are not confined to a few states or metro cities. "More than 50% of them belong to Tier II & Tier III cities," he added.

262.title: Biden says 'wealthiest firms must pay fair share to lower inflation', Bezos responds
262.article_body: The world's second richest person and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos responded after US President Joe Biden said that inflation could be brought down by making sure that the "wealthiest corporations pay their fair share". Bezos tweeted, "Raising corp taxes is fine to discuss. Taming inflation is critical to discuss. Mushing them together is just misdirection."

263.title: Punjabi University to fine ₹2,000 for feeding stray dogs at random spots
263.article_body: Patiala's Punjabi University on Friday announced that a fine of ₹2,000 will be imposed on people found feeding stray dogs at random places inside the campus. The varsity has designated three spots where the dogs can be fed. A fine of ₹2,000 will also be imposed on those who harass, beat or assault the dogs on campus, the university added.

264.title: 36-yr-old man arrested for raping, extorting money from woman in Mangaluru
264.article_body: Mangaluru Police on Friday arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly raping a woman and extorting money from her. The accused reportedly promised the woman of marriage and raped her repeatedly. He forced her to consume drugs and took her nude photos and videos on his phone, police said. He later blackmailed her and extorted ₹1.5 lakh from her, police added.

265.title: 50% of murders in B'luru in 2022 were due to domestic issues: Police
265.article_body: As per Bengaluru Police, nearly 50% of murders in the city reported until May 13, 2022, were due to domestic issues. The city has so far reported 49 murders, of which 23 are related to domestic issues. According to police, the offenders in these cases are not habitual criminals but common people who commit crimes in a fit of rage.

266.title: PMC to appoint IT nodal officers in all depts to help publish info
266.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to appoint two IT nodal officers in all of its departments to help publish information online. A circular was issued by PMC's Deputy Commissioner (General Administration) Sachin Ithape on the matter. "Information needs to be updated and uploaded from time to time for easy access to residents," the circular stated.

267.title: There are mountains to climb: Air India's new CEO to ex-colleagues in farewell note
267.article_body: Campbell Wilson, who has been appointed as Air India's CEO and MD, sent a farewell note to Scoot employees. After praising Scoot, Wilson wrote, "There are other mountains to climb, and I am humbled to have been selected…It's a fantastic opportunity to lead a historic airline, now owned by the Tata Group...I am grateful to embark on that...challenge."

268.title: Colombia to drop mandatory face mask requirements in schools
268.article_body: Schools in Colombia can drop the use of face masks in enclosed spaces on May 16, the country's Health Ministry said. Schools with 70% of their students and teachers fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and 40% having received a booster dose will be able to lift the mandate, the ministry added. Over 42% of children in Colombia are fully vaccinated.

269.title: All VIP rooms in jails to become staff management blocks: Punjab CM
269.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann announced on Saturday that all VIP rooms in jails will be converted into management blocks for prison staff to ensure their "smooth functioning", in a bid to end VIP culture there. He said that strict action will be taken in cases of negligence. He also added that 710 phones have been recovered from jails so far.

270.title: Pune reports 48 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, active cases at 266
270.article_body: Pune district on Friday reported 48 new COVID-19 cases and no deaths following which the active cases in the district rose to 266. Pune city reported 30 new cases, the areas under PCMC reported 12 new cases and Pune rural reported six new COVID-19 cases. A total of 18.29 million COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in Pune.

271.title: Putin losing confidence in Ukraine war: Ex-Russian PM
271.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has "already started to realise that he's losing this war", former Russian PM Mikhail Kasyanov said. He added that Putin may have been misled by his generals about the state of the war. Putin "believed that his army [was] in a great shape" and that the invasion would take very little time, Kasyanov said.

272.title: We were in a meeting, power went out suddenly: Mundka fire mishap survivor
272.article_body: Recalling the fire mishap incident which occurred in a three-storey commercial building near Delhi's Mundka metro station, one of the survivors said that they were in a meeting when suddenly power went out. "Someone said that a cloud of smoke is rising. There was chaos, windows were broken and people threw ropes at us to get down," survivor Bimla said.

273.title: Good luck & goodbye: Punjab Congress ex-chief Sunil Jakhar quits party
273.article_body: Senior Congress leader and former chief of Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) Sunil Jakhar on Saturday quit the party during a Facebook live broadcast. His announcement comes weeks after party leadership issued him a show-cause notice over his criticism of Charanjit Singh Channi. Congress leaders "sitting in Delhi ruined the party in Punjab," said Jakhar.

274.title: Ford sells Tesla-rival Rivian's shares for $188 mn, 2nd sale in days
274.article_body: Ford Motor has sold seven million shares of Tesla-rival Rivian for $188.2 million, or $26.88 apiece, the automaker revealed in a filing.  It now holds 86.9 million shares in the electric vehicle maker. Earlier this week, Ford had sold eight million of its shares of Tesla-rival Rivian for $214 million, or $26.80 apiece.

275.title: CSK's Rayudu says IPL 2022 will be his last as a player, deletes tweet later
275.article_body: CSK batter Ambati Rayudu took to Twitter to share that IPL 2022 will be his last as a player, however, he deleted the tweet later. "I've had a wonderful time playing it and being a part of two great teams for 13 years...Would love to sincerely thank Mumbai Indians and CSK for the wonderful journey," he had written.

276.title: KGF maker confirms part 3, says 'We're going to create Marvel kind of universe'
276.article_body: Vijay Kiragandur, founder of Hombale Films which produced 'K.G.F' and 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', has confirmed that the franchise is going to have another instalment. "Going forward, we're going to create a Marvel kind of universe," he said. Vijay added that they want to bring different characters from different movies and create "something like Doctor Strange" to reach a wider audience.

277.title: Copy-paste error by SBI clerk leads to transfer of ₹1.5 cr to wrong accounts in T'gana
277.article_body: A copy-paste error by an SBI clerk led to the transfer of ₹1.50 crore meant for the Telangana government's Dalit Bandhu scheme being mistakenly deposited into the accounts of 15 employees of Lotus Hospitals. Of those 15 who received ₹10 lakh each, 14 of them returned the money while one person used some of the money to clear previous debts.

278.title: Mumbai Police recreates racing game poster, says 'No need for speed'
278.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police shared the message of road safety by recreating 'Need for Speed' racing video game poster. Taking to Twitter, the Mumbai Police changed the video game name to "No Need for Speed" and said, "Being 'Fast and Furious' are only better in movies." The police shared the tweet with the hashtags #RoadSafety and #DriveWithinLimits.

279.title: MP CM announces ₹1 cr ex-gratia to kin of policemen killed by poachers in Guna
279.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced an ex-gratia of ₹1 crore to kin of three police personnel who were shot dead in an attack by blackbuck poachers in a forest in Guna district. One member of each of their families will be given a government job and their last rites will be held with full honour, the CM said.

280.title: May have to buy Twitter now: Snoop Dogg after Musk's deal put on hold
280.article_body: Rapper Snoop Dogg on Friday said that he "may have to buy Twitter now". Snoop Dogg’s tweet came after Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover bid was temporarily put on hold over fake account data. Snoop Dogg further stated rules for the company which included replacing the board of directors, giving everyone a verified account and putting free internet on planes.

281.title: Mars may have had water for longer than previously thought: Study
281.article_body: China's Zhurong rover has found evidence suggesting that water existed on Mars for much longer than expected. The finding is based on the hydrated minerals discovered by the rover in a vast basin believed to be the site of an ancient ocean. Signs of water were detected in sampled minerals from just 700 million years ago.

282.title: 31 pilgrims die in 12 days since Char Dham Yatra began: Official
282.article_body: At least 31 pilgrims have died due to health issues in the 12 days since the Char Dham Yatra began, an Uttarakhand health official said. "All of [the deceased] died due to high blood pressure, heart attack and mountain sickness," the state health department's director-general said. The director-general added that health screening of pilgrims has also been started.

283.title: Working to clarify Turkey's position on Finland, Sweden NATO bid: US
283.article_body: The US is "working to clarify Turkey's position" after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan expressed opposition to Finland and Sweden joining NATO, the White House said. "Turkey is a valued NATO ally...They've been involved and helpful in trying to get dialogue going between Russia and Ukraine...So nothing changes about their standing in the NATO alliance," Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said.

284.title: Morrison vows to be 'more empathetic' if re-elected as Australian PM
284.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison has promised to be "more empathetic" if he wins re-election. Recent polls show Morrison's Liberal-National coalition trailing behind the opposition Labor Party. The Morrison government has been criticised for its handling of bushfires that killed 24 people and left thousands homeless, slow procurement of COVID-19 vaccines and rising cost of living, among other things.

285.title: Global stocks record 6th consecutive losing week, longest since 2008
285.article_body: The global stocks dipped for the sixth consecutive week while the FTSE All-World index is on its longest weekly losing streak since the middle of 2008. The index dropped 2.4% this week, while the US benchmark S&P 500 index fell 2.4% and Nasdaq dipped by 2.8%. The Dow slipped for the seventh consecutive week.

286.title: RCB's Rajat Patidar's 102-metre six hits elderly man's head, video goes viral
286.article_body: RCB batter Rajat Patidar slammed a 102-metre six on the bowling of PBKS all-rounder Harpreet Brar, which went on to hit an elderly man's head in the stands after ricocheting from a banner. A video has gone viral showing the man looking in discomfort. "Hope he is doing fine," a fan commented on the video.

287.title: 36-year-old police sub-inspector dies by suicide in Andhra
287.article_body: A 36-year-old police sub-inspector posted at Sarpavaram Police Station, Kakinada, allegedly died by suicide at his residence at Sarpavaram in Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district on Friday. "As per the complaint by his wife, we have registered the case. We are investigating the case," police said.

288.title: 2 arrested after women accuse each other’s husbands of rape in Surat
288.article_body: Two men were arrested in Surat after their wives accused each other's husbands of rape on Friday. The two accused are friends. While one woman alleged the husband of the other woman raped her after a fight, the latter alleged the former's husband raped her when her husband was away. The women had reportedly fought with each other on Thursday.

289.title: Kejriwal visits Mundka, orders probe into fire incident that killed 27
289.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reached the spot where a massive fire broke out in a building near the Mundka metro station which led to the death of 27 people. "Delhi government has ordered a magisterial enquiry into the incident," he added. "Families of the deceased will be given ₹10 lakh compensation, while the injured will be given ₹50,000," Kejriwal stated.

290.title: BSF troops open fire at Pak drone near IB in Jammu, force it to return
290.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) troops spotted a drone at around 4:45 am on Saturday near International Border (IB) in RS Pura's Arnia Sector in Jammu and fired seven-eight rounds of bullets at it. "The drone went back to the Pakistan side," BSF added. "A massive search operation was launched...to ensure no weapons or narcotics were dropped," an official said.

291.title: Girls' school alumnae call out teacher for sexual abuse on his FB post in Kerala
291.article_body: Several former students of a girls' school in Kerala called out a former teacher of sexually abusing them after he shared a picture on Facebook from his retirement function. He is accused of allegedly molesting more than 60 students in 30 years of his career. The teacher is also a CPM councillor in Kerala's Malappuram district.

292.title: 2 middlemen arrested in Pune kidney transplant malpractice case
292.article_body: Two middlemen have been arrested for being involved in the alleged kidney transplant malpractice at a clinic in Pune. A woman had reportedly posed as the wife of a man who needed a transplant on being promised ₹15 lakh. The duo "played a key role" in completing paperwork to present the woman as the man's wife, a police officer said.

293.title: Gundala police station under Warangal limits transferred to Rachakonda
293.article_body: The Gundala Mandal police station has been transferred to Rachakonda Police Commissionerate from Warangal Police Commissionerate. The Gundala police station will hereafter be included in Bhongir Zone, Yadadri division, Yadagirigutta Circle, as per the release. The staff of Gundala police station will continue to serve citizens under supervision of Rachakonda Police Commissioner, the release said.

294.title: Was nervous: Anushka on resuming work on 'Chakda...' after Vamika's birth
294.article_body: Anushka Sharma revealed that her film 'Chakda 'Xpress' got postponed due to COVID-19 pandemic and her pregnancy. "When I...began working on it, I was really nervous...because I'd just had a baby (Vamika) so I wasn't as strong as before," she added. "Though I wasn't sure whether to take [it]...or not, inner voice kept telling me to do it," said Anushka.

295.title: Illicit liquor worth ₹1.62 crore destroyed using bulldozers in Guj
295.article_body: The police and administration in Gandhidham in Gujarat's Kachchh have destroyed over 25,000 bottles of Indian Made Foreign Liquor and beer cans worth ₹1.62 crore, which had been seized in multiple prohibition-related cases. The illicit liquor, seized during 2020-21, was destroyed with the help of bulldozers, according to the police. The drive took place over two hours.

296.title: Delhivery IPO worth ₹5,235 crore subscribed 1.63 times on Day 3
296.article_body: Delhivery IPO worth ₹5,235 crore was subscribed 1.63 times on the final day of subscription which ended on Friday. Retail investors bid for 57% of the shares reserved for them, while employees booked 27% of their portion. Meanwhile, non-institutional investors bid for 30% shares of the allotted quota. The QIB category was subscribed 2.66 times.

297.title: Felt hurt and lonely after husband's affair in US: Mumtaz on her extra-marital affair
297.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz, in an interview, said she got into an extra-marital relationship after feeling lonely and hurt on knowing about her husband's affair in US. "I flew down to India. When you are amidst thorns and someone comes along with a rose...you do get carried away. But it was nothing serious. Just a temporary phase," she added.

298.title: Centre clueless on ways to lift economy: P Chidambaram
298.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised the central government for the current economic situation in the country and said that the Centre appears "clueless" on ways to deal with the situation. "Slower growth rate is hallmark of the present government," Chidambaram added. Centre is fuelling rise of inflation by high taxes on petrol, diesel and high administered prices, he further said.

299.title: Neena, director said I was bad, didn't know how to act: Amit on 'Kyun Hota...'
299.article_body: Amit Sadh, who made his debut with the show 'Kyun Hota Hai Pyarrr', recalled his first scene and revealed that he took 40-50 retakes and gave a very bad shot. "Neena Gupta, director Nupur...said I was so bad and didn't know how to act," he said, adding, "Then they discussed...there's something in my eyes and I'd...energy, so I should stay."

300.title: Senior BJP leader goes missing in Odisha, family alleges abduction
300.article_body: Senior BJP leader and former MLA from Odisha's Ganjam, Saroj Padhy, has gone missing from his house, police said. "His phone is switched off since yesterday...we suspect he has been abducted as he was upset for the last few days over frequent calls that he had been receiving," Padhy's son on Friday said. Padhy was a Congress MLA from Aska.

301.title: How do I edit a typo on Twitter? Oh right: Bezos on his incorrect tweet
301.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to remark about the absence of an edit button on the platform in an apparent reference. Responding to an earlier tweet wherein he had made an error, Bezos wrote, "Help me out. How do I edit a typo on Twitter? Oh right..." Earlier in April, Twitter confirmed it's working on an edit button.

302.title: Trump's media firm starts hiring for its upcoming streaming platform
302.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's media venture has posted job openings for two professionals for its upcoming streaming platform TMTG+. It said the platform will offer "entertainment rooted in free speech" and deliver "a wide variety of non-scripted, scripted, and original content". It posted a requirement for a content acquisitional professional "to oversee content licensing and acquisition".

303.title: Accused New York subway shooter pleads not guilty to terrorism
303.article_body: A 62-year-old man charged with last month's mass shooting in a New York subway pleaded not guilty to terrorism and weapons charges on Friday. Frank James is accused of setting off smoke grenades and firing a handgun about 33 times on a crowded train on April 12. The attack had left 29 people injured, including 10 who were shot.

304.title: B'luru traffic police get drain grill fixed after complaint; share video
304.article_body: Bengaluru's Banasawadi Traffic Police Station on Friday shared a video of getting a drain grill on a road repaired after a Twitter user raised a complaint. "Ring road of Bengaluru is one of [the] busiest transport routes...Kindly arrange repair before accidents occur," the Twitter user had said. The repaired grill will allow "smooth flow of vehicles", the traffic police said.

305.title: 3 policemen shot dead by blackbuck poachers in Madhya Pradesh's Guna
305.article_body: Three policemen were shot dead by suspected blackbuck poachers in Madhya Pradesh's Guna. "In Aron Police Station area...information about seven-eight motorcycle-borne miscreants was received...police surrounded them...miscreants started firing," state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. "Instructions have been given to take a strict action against the criminals to set an example," he added.

306.title: Save screens from international films, don't fight among yourselves: Kangana
306.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has said that the American film industry has single-handedly destroyed the German, Italian and French film industries, adding that "we've to collectively...fight against Hollywood and save our screens from international films". "We've to not fight among ourselves, be it South film industries like Kannada, Tamil [or] Telugu film industry, we've to encourage them all," she added.

307.title: Every single way that you can possibly get out, it's happening to him: Faf on Kohli
307.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's dismissals in IPL 2022, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said, "Every single way that you can possibly get out, it's happening to him." Du Plessis added, "That's how the game works." He further said that Kohli is seeing the lighter side of it. "Tough patches are difficult, but he's in good spirits," Du Plessis stated.

308.title: Rachakonda Police busts red sanders smuggling racket, 1,500 kg logs seized
308.article_body: Rachakonda Police busted an inter-state red sanders smuggling racket operating from Andhra Pradesh and arrested two persons in the matter. The police seized 31 red sanders logs worth ₹60 lakh and weighing nearly 1,500 kg. Due to financial loss in the banana business, the arrested duo decided to procure and sell red sanders to clear their debts, the police said.

309.title: 25-yr-old man arrested for stalking woman on social media in Delhi
309.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stalking a woman on social media in Delhi. In her complaint, the woman alleged that the accused had been stalking her since February 14. He was using various fake IDs to conceal his identity, police said. During interrogation, police found that the accused saw the woman somewhere, after which he started stalking her.

310.title: Right-wing group chief seeks demolition of illegal K'taka churches
310.article_body: Right-wing group Sri Ram Sene chief Pramod Muthalik on Friday called for the demolition of illegal churches in Karnataka by "bulldozers" and a "stringent" law against conversions. He claimed that thousands of Hindus are being converted to Christianity by "force and deceit" every day. Earlier, state Cabinet passed the anti-conversion bill and used the ordinance route to give it effect.

311.title: Ukraine ready to return bodies of Russian soldiers: Official
311.article_body: The Ukrainian military has loaded Russian soldiers' bodies collected after fighting in the country's Kyiv and Chernihiv regions onto refrigerated rail cars. Ukraine is acting in accordance with international law and is "ready to return the bodies to the aggressor", Ukraine's civil-military cooperation head Volodymr Lyamzin said. There're many refrigerator trains stationed across Ukraine, he added.

312.title: Punjabi singer, 1 other held for beating car driver in Chandigarh
312.article_body: Punjabi singer Kamal Khaira and another man were arrested on Thursday for allegedly beating up a car driver after a road accident near Panjab University. Hardik Ahluwalia alleged when he was on the way home along with his friends in his car, Khaira's rashly driven car came without blowing the horn and hit his car, following which he was assaulted.

313.title: Mumbai to get additional 1,000 MW as Maha govt approves Kudus-Aarey transmission line
313.article_body: The Maharashtra government has approved implementation of an 80 km long high-voltage direct current (HVDC) transmission line between Kudus and Aarey Colony which will help evacuate 1,000 MW power from outside to Mumbai. The transmission line will be built by Adani Electricity Mumbai Limited. The project cost is estimated at ₹7,500 crore and is expected to be completed by 2025-26.

314.title: Musk announces 'random sampling' of 100 Twitter followers after deal put on hold
314.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said his team will do a random sampling of 100 followers on Twitter after the acquisition deal was put on hold over fake account data. Replying to a Twitter user, Musk said he picked 100 as the sample size number because that is what Twitter uses to calculate under 5% fake, spam or duplicate accounts.

315.title: Nikitin Dheer, Kratika Sengar name their daughter Devika Dheer
315.article_body: Actor Nikitin Dheer and his actress wife Kratika Sengar on Thursday welcomed their first child, a baby girl. The couple took to their respective Instagram handles to share the name of their newborn daughter. They shared an image of a rainbow with a text that read, "And so the adventure begins. We welcome our baby girl. Devika Dheer 12/05/2022."

316.title: Apple is testing iPhone models with USB-C ports: Report
316.article_body: Apple has been testing iPhones that are equipped with USB-C ports instead of Lightning ports in recent months, Bloomberg reported. It's also working on an adapter that would let future iPhones work with accessories designed for the current Lightning connector. Apple does not plan to make the switch from Lightning to USB-C until 2023 at the earliest.

317.title: Exercise your 'Right to Nap' in the office, says Wakefit.co in new video
317.article_body: Wakefit.co has launched the 'Do Se Dhai' movement, extending its 'Right to Nap' initiative to make afternoon naps during office hours a reality in every workplace. After declaring 2:00 to 2:30 pm as official nap time for its employees, Wakefit.co is now urging everyone to be a part of this movement and normalise naps at the workplace.

318.title: Building didn't have fire NOC, owner absconding: Delhi Police on Mundka fire
318.article_body: The building that caught fire near Mundka metro station on Friday evening did not have fire NOC, Delhi Police said. "The owner of the building who lived on the top floor is currently absconding, teams are on the job and he will be nabbed soon," police said. At least 27 people died in the fire incident, police added.

319.title: IPL commentator Simon Doull shares screenshot of troll abusing him on Instagram
319.article_body: IPL commentator Simon Doull took to Twitter to share a screenshot of a troll abusing him on Instagram. Alongside the screenshot, Doull wrote, "Can’t believe I still get work if I'm so bad. Hope you're amazing at your job whoever you are. Maybe come out from hiding behind...fake name and we can have a chat about our jobs."

320.title: Relied on Twitter's earlier filings: Musk on fake account data
320.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked by a Twitter user why he didn't think of fake accounts percentage earlier, said, "I relied upon the accuracy of Twitter's public filings." This comes after Musk announced that his Twitter deal was temporarily put on hold. Musk's team will do a random sampling of 100 Twitter followers to check for fake accounts.

321.title: TN CM inaugurates Chennai's longest 2.03-km long unidirectional flyover
321.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Friday inaugurated Chennai's longest unidirectional flyover running for a distance of 2.03 kilometres. Tambaram-Velachery bridge over the Medavakkam flyover was constructed at an estimated cost of ₹95.21 crore, Stalin's office said. With this, the state highways department has completed two unidirectional three-lane flyovers on Velachery-Tambaram Radial road.

322.title: UK imposes sanctions on Putin's ex-wife & alleged girlfriend
322.article_body: The UK on Friday imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's ex-wife and his alleged current girlfriend over Ukraine invasion. Lyudmila Ocheretnaya, who was married to Putin until 2014, and former Olympic gymnast Alina Kabaeva will be subjected to asset freezes and travel bans. The UK has now placed over 1,000 individuals and 100 entities on its Russian sanctions list.

323.title: India records 2,858 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, active cases reach 18,096
323.article_body: India has reported 2,858 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The COVID-19 death toll climbed to 5,24,201 after 11 deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours. Moreover, 3,355 recoveries were also reported during the same time period. The active case tally in India stands at 18,096.

324.title: India bans wheat exports with immediate effect
324.article_body: The Indian government has banned the export of wheat with immediate effect. The Centre said that there has been a sudden spike in prices of wheat due to which "the food security of India, neighbouring countries and other vulnerable countries is at risk". Shipments of wheat are allowed for letters of credit that have already been issued, the government said.

325.title: Mumbai local train services to be hit on Sunday due to maintenance work
325.article_body: Mumbai's local train services will be severely affected on Sunday as the division will suspend Harbour line train services between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and Panvel, Belapur and Vashi from 10:34 am to 3:54 pm to carry out maintenance works. Harbour line passengers are permitted to travel via Thane-Vashi and Nerul stations from 10 am to 6 pm.

326.title: Pune court grants bail to builder, 6 others in black magic case
326.article_body: A Pune court has granted anticipatory bail to a builder, his wife, three sons, a maidservant and a priest. The accused were held for harassing the builder's daughter-in-law for not bearing a baby boy and for indulging in black magic. The victim was forced to drink unhygienic water mixed with a powder, as per the FIR.

327.title: Extremely saddened, says PM Modi on Mundka fire; announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia
327.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has expressed his grief after at least 27 people died in a fire that broke out in Delhi's Mundka. PM tweeted, "Extremely saddened by the loss of lives due to the tragic fire...My thoughts are with the bereaved families." PM Modi also announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased.

328.title: B'luru acid attacker stays at TN ashram posing as a saint; arrested
328.article_body: The police on Friday arrested Nagesh Babu who is accused of pouring acid on a 24-year-old woman in Bengaluru from an ashram in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai. The accused, who had been absconding for around two weeks, was staying at the ashram disguised as a saint. The man had reportedly done so after the woman rejected his marriage proposal.

329.title: No one can predict length of Ukraine war: Zelenskyy
329.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that "no one today can predict how long this war will last". "However, this depends, unfortunately, not only on our people, who are already doing the maximum. It also depends on our partners, on European countries, on the countries of the whole free world," Zelenskyy said. Russian forces began invading Ukraine on February 24.

330.title: World's longest suspension footbridge opens in Czech Republic, pic surfaces
330.article_body: The world's longest suspension footbridge, named Sky Bridge 721, was opened to public in Czech Republic's Dolni Morava village on Friday. The 2,365-foot-long bridge is built at an altitude of more than 3,610 feet above sea level. The construction of the bridge took two years and cost around 200 million Czech crowns ($8.3 million).

331.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as RCB record second-worst NRR?
331.article_body: Following their defeat against PBKS, RCB now have the second-worst net run-rate (NRR). RCB are fourth on the IPL 2022 points table with 14 points and NRR of -0.323. DC and PBKS have 12 points each, with DC having a better NRR. Among the teams having 10 points each, SRH have a superior NRR of -0.031.

332.title: Alibaba lays off 40% of AliExpress Russia staff amid war: Report
332.article_body: China's Alibaba has laid off about 40% of AliExpress Russia staff amid the ongoing Ukrainian war, the Nikkei reported. Some of the laid-off staff chose to leave voluntarily and a few relocated. The firm's commercial division was hit the hardest due to the layoffs. AliExpress Russia is a joint venture launched in 2019 by Alibaba and Russian partners.

333.title: Won't use Musk's deal to avoid making important decisions: Twitter CEO
333.article_body: After two top executives were fired on Friday, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal said he won't use the acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk "as an excuse to avoid making important decisions" for Twitter. He wrote, "While I expect the deal to close, we need to be prepared for all scenarios…Our industry is in a very challenging macro environment...right now."

334.title: Video of black cat interrupting RCB-PBKS match goes viral
334.article_body: A video of a black cat interrupting RCB-PBKS match has gone viral. During the first over of RCB's innings, the cat was seen sitting on sightscreen, briefly halting the match. "Best part is that the cat was licking its paw, not caring about anything else. Cat 1-0 IPL," a fan tweeted. "Black cat on Friday the 13th," wrote another user.

335.title: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern tests positive for COVID-19
335.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has tested positive for COVID-19 with moderate symptoms. Ardern has been in isolation since Sunday, when her partner Clarke Gayford tested positive for the virus. She will be required to isolate until the morning of May 21. Ardern's daughter Neve had tested COVID-19 positive on Wednesday.

336.title: Tea, water for drivers on Yamuna Expressway to stay awake: Officials
336.article_body: UP traffic police and employees of Jewar toll plaza have decided to give tea and water to the drivers on Yamuna Expressway to ensure they remain awake. "There are over 16 lanes...We can allow drivers to park...rest here if they feel...sleepy," an employee of the plaza said. This comes after five people were killed in an accident on the expressway.

337.title: Couple, 2 others carry out sex determination test in Pune; booked
337.article_body: A married couple and two others were booked for allegedly carrying out an illegal sex determination test in Pune's Indapur on Friday. The arrests were made after a hospital's superintendent got information that some people were taking a sex determination test in a car. Medical staff and police found a man conducting the test on checking the car.

338.title: No one at Twitter working just to keep lights on: CEO on changes in company
338.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal in a post remarked that "no one at Twitter is working just to keep the lights on." The post which came after two top executives were fired, further read, "Some have been asking why a "lame-duck" CEO would make these changes if we're getting acquired anyway…Regardless of the company's future ownership, we're...improving Twitter as a product."

339.title: Expect more change for better: Twitter CEO after firing 2 top executives
339.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Saturday shared a detailed thread about the changes in the company after two top executives were fired a day before. Parag wrote, "So what can you expect from me going forward? I'm still focused on doing the job, and that includes making hard decisions as needed...And you can expect more change for the better."

340.title: PBKS register their 2nd win against RCB in IPL 2022, jump to 6th spot
340.article_body: PBKS registered their second victory against RCB in IPL 2022 after defeating them by 54 runs at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. With the win, PBKS jumped to the sixth spot with 12 points from 12 matches. Liam Livingstone top-scored for PBKS with 70(42), while their fast bowler Kagiso Rabada took three wickets.

341.title: India enter first-ever Thomas Cup final, beats Denmark 3-2
341.article_body: Indian men's badminton team has created history by reaching the Thomas Cup final for the first time after defeating Denmark 3-2 in semi-final on Friday. While Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty, Kidambi Srikanth and HS Prannoy won their respective matches, Lakshya Sen and Krishna Prasad Garaga-Vishnuvardhan Goud Panjala lost. India will face Indonesia in the final on Sunday.

342.title: Kerala is rapidly becoming 'Talibanised': State BJP President
342.article_body: Kerala BJP President K Surendran criticised the state government, saying Kerala is rapidly becoming "Talibanised". Surendran's comment came days after a Muslim cleric opposed a class 10 girl's presence on the stage at a felicitation ceremony in Malappuram. "Kerala is moving towards the ideology followed by Taliban with the help and knowledge of the Chief Minister," Surendran said.

343.title: Japan to offer $100 mn to Indo-Pacific nations to fight COVID-19
343.article_body: Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi on Friday announced that Japan plans to offer $100 million in aid to developing countries in the Indo-Pacific region in their fight against the coronavirus pandemic. The funds will help in vaccination data management, border control and disposal of infectious waste, he said. Hayashi made the comments on sidelines of a G7 Foreign Ministers meeting.

344.title: Lucknow Police ban e-rickshaws on 11 routes in city
344.article_body: Lucknow Police said that e-rickshaws have been banned on 11 routes in the city to improve the traffic system. These routes include Shaheed Path, Hazratganj market and metro routes from Amausi to Munshi Pulia crossing, the police added. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic), Subhash Chandra Shakya, said that e-rickshaws have been causing inconvenience to commuters.

345.title: RCB is playing like proper unit in IPL 2022: Dasgupta
345.article_body: Commenting on RCB's form in ongoing IPL, Deep Dasgupta said they are playing like a proper unit. "In their last game (against SRH), they delivered their best performance of this season. For example, Rajat Patidar has been contributing in almost every match, which has been the hallmark of the team," he added. RCB are currently fourth on points table.

346.title: More Indians die in road accidents than in war: Union Minister
346.article_body: Addressing an event organised by ASSOCHAM, Union Minister General (Retd) VK Singh said that more Indians die in road accidents than in a war. He said road safety is the most important issue that the government needs to tackle. "We have road safety week. We upgraded it to road safety month," he said, adding it should be a 365-day affair.

347.title: Bihar-based cyber fraudsters who cheated people of ₹1 cr arrested
347.article_body: The Cyber Police busted a Bihar-based gang that cheated people of up to ₹1 crore and arrested three persons, along with equipment and documents used by them, the police said. They added that the gang cheated people on the pretext of providing them benefits of various government schemes through fake websites. The police said they managed to recover ₹8.39 lakh.

348.title: Biden considering visit to DMZ during trip to S Korea: White House
348.article_body: The White House Press Secretary on Thursday said that US President Joe Biden is considering a trip to the Korean Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) when he visits Asia later this month. Biden is expected to visit South Korea and Japan from May 20-24. The White House was still finalising details of the Asia schedule, the secretary added.

349.title: IFS officer spots leopard outside rest house, says 'spent time in each other's company'
349.article_body: IFS officer Akash Deep Badhawan shared a picture of a leopard outside his rest house. "Like a Ruskin Bond story, met this one outside a Forest Rest House...we spent a good amount of time in each other's company last night," he tweeted. "So much wildlife history in the walls of these 120 plus years old FRH of Katarniaghat," he added.

350.title: Kohli looks towards sky & speaks to himself after getting out for 20, video goes viral
350.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli looked towards the sky and spoke to himself after getting out for 20(14) against PBKS. Kohli was caught out at short fine leg after the ball brushed his glove and lobbed off his thigh pad. "Hope luck turns on your side soon!" PBKS tweeted. A user tweeted, "Kohli literally begging for some luck."

351.title: MP may consider national anthem recital mandate in madrasas: Minister
351.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Friday said the state government may consider making the recital of the national anthem mandatory in all madrasas in the state. Mishra's statement comes a day after the Uttar Pradesh government issued an order mandating recital of the national anthem in all madrasas. Mishra added that the national anthem can be sung everywhere.

352.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of forcibly deporting over 2 lakh children
