352.article_body: Russia has forcibly deported more than 2.1 lakh children since the start of its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Ukraine's ombudsman for human rights Lyudmyla Denisova said on Friday. Ukraine has also accused Russia of wanting to make the deported children Russian citizens. Denisova claimed that the children are among the 12 lakh people forcibly deported by Russia.

353.title: Children fall as water slide breaks at amusement park in Indonesia, video surfaces
353.article_body: A video has shown children falling around 10 feet to the ground after a water slide broke in half during their ride at an amusement park in Indonesia. The incident took place recently in Kenjeran park in East Java. The video shows water rushing out as the slide structure collapses. Around 16 children were injured in the incident.

354.title: Beach house worth ₹3cr collapses into the ocean in US as sea levels rise, pic surfaces
354.article_body: A beach house worth $3,81,200 (nearly ₹3 crore) in North Carolina's Outer Banks recently collapsed. It was unoccupied at the time, officials said, adding the area has been closed off for time being. The collapse is part of what officials worry could be a growing issue amid severe weather this week as well as long-term concerns like rising sea levels.

355.title: It's a reflection of them, not me or my wife: Ranveer on trolling
355.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, on being asked about trolling received by him and his wife Deepika Padukone, stated that it's just a reflection of them and not him or his wife. "When that criticism comes, it's so absolutely baseless that I don't even subscribe to the idea that it should be put forth, let alone be affected by it," Ranveer added.

356.title: Guv must reject it: Siddaramaiah on K'taka anti-conversion bill
356.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the BJP over the anti-conversion bill and urged the Governor to reject it. He said the BJP was trying to 'force' anti-conversion law on the people through an ordinance route to 'divert their attention' from issues like corruption and lack of administration. He alleged that the bill will be used to "threaten and harass minorities".

357.title: Meghalaya woman tied to pole, heckled by onlookers for pickpocketing
357.article_body: A woman was tied to a pole at a marketplace in Meghalaya's Jowai and heckled by onlookers for alleged pickpocketing, police said. A video of the incident surfaced on social media, in which she was purportedly seen being taken to a shed by unknown persons. "All the people seen in the video will be called for questioning," an officer said.

358.title: Iraqi-born man injures 5 people in knife attack on train in Germany
358.article_body: An Iraqi-born man injured five people during a knife attack on a train in Germany on Friday, authorities said. The 31-year-old attacker was overpowered by an off-duty police officer and two other passengers. Notably, the man had been investigated for possible Islamic extremism while living in a refugee hostel in 2017, a top law enforcement official said.

359.title: 16 killed in fire at building near Delhi's Mundka metro station
359.article_body: At least 16 bodies have been recovered so far from the building that caught on fire near the Mundka metro station on Friday, Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said. Around 10 people have been injured and more are trapped inside the three-storey commercial building, Delhi Police said. The third floor is yet to be searched, Garg said.

360.title: Over 350 Kashmiri Pandit govt employees submit mass resignation letter to J&K L-G
360.article_body: Over 350 Kashmiri Pandit employees under the Prime Minister's employment package have submitted a mass resignation letter to J&K Lieutenant Governor (L-G) Manoj Sinha. In the letter, they reportedly told L-G and Centre that they didn't feel safe in Kashmir. This comes after Kashmiri Pandit government employee Rahul Bhat was shot dead by terrorists in tehsildar office in Budgam.

361.title: SRH's Malik can play for any team if he brings control with pace: McGrath
361.article_body: Talking about Umran Malik's performance in IPL 2022, ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath said if the SRH pacer can combine control with his sheer pace then he'll get into any team in the world. The 22-year-old from Jammu and Kashmir has clocked 150 kmph consistently in the ongoing IPL. Malik has so far taken 15 wickets in 11 matches for SRH.

362.title: PM Narendra Modi is a man of ideas: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
362.article_body: Speaking at the launch of a technical training programme for rural tribals in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan called PM Narendra Modi a "man of ideas". "Fortunately, this country has a visionary prime minister. He has not only visions, but also ideas to execute them on the ground," he said.

363.title: I'm not injured, I'm living with an injury: Nadal on his foot pain
363.article_body: Ten-time champion Rafael Nadal said he was suffering with a lot of foot pain in his third-round loss against 13th seed Denis Shapovalov at 2022 Italian Open.  "No, I'm not injured. I'm a player living with an injury. That's it. No, no, is nothing new," he added. Nadal had ended his 2021 season early due to a left foot injury.

364.title: Congress party's 'chintan shivir' is 'chinta shivir': MP minister
364.article_body: BJP leader and Madhya Pradesh's Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Friday said the Congress party's 'chintan shivir' is 'chinta shivir' to save their party. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said the party will introspect its strengths and weaknesses during the three-day 'chintan shivir'. Surjewala stated inflation, unemployment and increasing debt as reasons for holding the session.

365.title: Govt is hiding its failures by spreading hatred: Mehbooba Mufti
365.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti accused the Central government of "spreading hatred between Hindus and Muslims just to hide its failures". "It is presenting the two communities as enemies of each other," she said. Speaking after the killing of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat, Mufti urged Muslims of the valley to help and support the minorities living there.

366.title: South Korea plans to provide COVID-19 vaccine to North Korea
366.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol's office on Friday announced that South Korea plans to provide COVID-19 vaccines and other medical supplies to North Korea. "We will discuss detailed plans for assistance with North Korea," the President's office said. The announcement comes a day after North Korea confirmed its first coronavirus outbreak.

367.title: G7 strongly united in supporting Ukraine until victory, says France
367.article_body: French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian on Friday said that G7 countries are "very strongly united" in their will to continue to provide support to Ukraine in its fight against Russia until a Ukrainian victory. "It's very important...that we keep up the pressure on Vladimir Putin by supplying more weapons to Ukraine," British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

368.title: Congress wants to make itself stronger: Kharge at 'Chintan Shivir'
368.article_body: Addressing party workers in Udaipur at Congress' 'Chintan Shivir', Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge said that the party wants to make itself stronger. Speaking about an alliance with other parties, he said, "We want to take all parties on board but it can only happen if they have similar ideologies, belief in the social fabric and democratic values."

369.title: Things are finally working for me after 20 years: Manav Kaul
369.article_body: Actor Manav Kaul has stated that after 20 years of his career, things are "finally" working for him. The actor further said that OTT platforms are not just about the actors but about creative people, DOPs, directors and other technical crew. "What makes me happier is that there are so many women writers...stories about women and...women-led projects," Manav added.

370.title: More Indians anaemic than before, 67% kids under 5 affected: NFHS
370.article_body: An increasing number of people across all population groups in India, including children, adolescent girls and boys and pregnant women, is being affected by anaemia, according to the National Family Health Survey-5 (NFHS). According to the survey report, at least 67% children below the age of five years have anaemia, compared to 58.6% in the last survey conducted in 2015-16.

371.title: Unlike Hindi film industry, South industry has got its math right: Richa Chadha
371.article_body: Richa Chadha has said South industry has got its math right in terms of numbers and ticket prices. "Unlike...Hindi film industry and its greedy film distributors, there they keep...ticket at ₹100-400 even if it's a hit...Over here, due to...ticket priced above ₹400, footfall will decrease," she stated. "Audience will pay for food and beverage. Naturally, cinema will suffer," said Richa.

372.title: RCB's Josh Hazlewood records worst bowling figures of IPL 2022
372.article_body: RCB fast bowler Josh Hazlewood on Friday recorded the worst bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 31-year-old Australian conceded 64 runs without taking a wicket against PBKS. Hazlewood, whose figures read 4-0-64-0, was hit for seven fours and four sixes in his spell. The previous worst bowling figures of IPL 2022 were 4-0-63-0 recorded by SRH fast bowler Marco Jansen.

373.title: Man cheats 100 women of lakhs by posing as MBA graduate on matrimonial site
373.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who has studied till class 12, cheated over 100 women of lakhs of rupees by posing as an engineering and MBA graduate on a matrimonial site, police said. Farhan Khan was arrested after a female AIIMS doctor, who was cheated of ₹15 lakh, filed a complaint in Delhi. One BMW car was seized from his possession.

374.title: MVA govt must introspect: BJP MP on Patole's 'backstabber' remark
374.article_body: BJP MP Gopal Shetty criticised Congress' Nana Patole for his 'backstabbing' remark, saying all three parties of MVA- Shiv Sena, Congress and NCP should 'introspect and quit the government'. He said, "All three parties...have backstabbed the BJP and Devendra Fadnavis." His comment came after Patole called NCP 'backstabber' as it joined hands with BJP during the Gondia Zilla Parishad elections.

375.title: Malayalam cinema ahead of others in terms of content: Mammootty
375.article_body: Actor Mammootty has stated that Malayalam cinema is ahead of other industries in terms of content, adding that the Hindi film industry pays a lot of attention to Malayalam cinema. The actor further said that OTT platforms brought the silent audience into the cinema fold which was earlier unable to go to theatres due to the lack of time.

376.title: Hyderabad Police chief holds meet with pub & restaurant owners
376.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand conducted a meeting with pub and restaurant owners to 'reiterate the government's stand against drug abuse'. This meeting comes after drugs were found on the premises of Pudding and Mink pub, the police said. In the meeting, the Commissioner also raised the issue of complaints by citizens regarding sound pollution, parking congestion, etc.

377.title: 11 including 10 students injured as truck hits school bus in Haryana
377.article_body: At least 10 students and a bus conductor sustained injuries after a truck allegedly hit a private school bus carrying at least 25 students in Haryana's Sonipat on Friday. "Preliminary probe has found that the truck driver was speeding and he rammed into the bus from the side. The windowpanes of the bus shattered upon impact," a police officer said.

378.title: India declares 1-day state mourning tomorrow after UAE President's demise
378.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Friday announced that one-day state mourning will be observed in India on Saturday as a mark of respect on the passing away of UAE President and Abu Dhabi ruler Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan. The National Flag will be flown at half-mast on all the buildings where the Tricolour is flown regularly tomorrow.

379.title: Growing up, I wanted to play and behave like him: Shapovalov on Nadal
379.article_body: Following his third round win over Rafael Nadal at 2022 Italian Open, 13th seed Denis Shapovalov said he's a huge fan of the 10-time champion. "Growing up, I wanted to play and behave like him." He added, "I definitely super-look up to him." Shapovalov beat Nadal 1-6, 7-5, 6-2 on Thursday. It was the Canadian's second win against the Spaniard.

380.title: If I were a selector, I'd pick Karthik for India's T20 WC squad: Harbhajan
380.article_body: Praising Dinesh Karthik, Harbhajan Singh said the RCB wicketkeeper-batter has been outstanding and he's the best finisher in ongoing IPL. "If I were a selector I would've given him a ticket to Australia for World Cup T20 and let him play for India as wicketkeeper and batsman," he added. Karthik has scored 274 runs in 12 matches so far.

381.title: Bengaluru temperature currently cooler than many hill stations, Twitter users react
381.article_body: Bengaluru on Wednesday recorded a maximum temperature of 24.3°C, the lowest in May in the last 10 years, according to IMD. As per Twitter users, Bengaluru was cooler than many hill stations in India, with many users posting screenshots of weather apps. "Packing bags already!" a user tweeted while another wrote, "Bangalore giving hill stations a run for their money."

382.title: 'SpiceJet charging extra for boarding pass,' says woman; Scindia replies 'will examine'
382.article_body: A woman took to Twitter to complain about SpiceJet, stating that the airline is charging extra if a passenger wishes to get a boarding pass at check-in counter. After a journalist called the rule "ridiculous" and tagged Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, the minister replied, saying, "Agreed, will examine this asap!" More airlines are reportedly charging passengers for boarding passes.

383.title: Turkey not supportive of Finland & Sweden joining NATO: Prez
383.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Friday said that NATO-member Turkey does not support plans by Sweden and Finland to join the military alliance. Erdoğan also claimed that the Nordic countries were home to many "terrorist organisations". Notably, Turkey has criticised Sweden and Western European countries for their handling of organisations deemed terrorists by the Turkish government.

384.title: 30 policemen hurt as Maha villagers clash over Shivaji statue, 300 booked
384.article_body: Over 30 police personnel received minor injuries after two groups of villagers clashed in Maharashtra's Jalna district. The clashes took place over the installation and removal of a statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and naming of a newly-constructed gate in the village after late BJP leader Gopinath Munde. According to police, over 300 people have been booked for violence.

385.title: Pic showing Zakir Hussain as Pt Shivkumar's pallbearer at his funeral surfaces
385.article_body: A picture showing renowned tabla artist Zakir Hussain shouldering the remains of santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma has been widely shared online. Sharma was cremated with full state honours in Mumbai on Wednesday. Hussain and Sharma were reportedly friends and collaborators for decades. "Never seen a more poignant photograph," said a Twitter user while reacting to Hussain's picture.

386.title: Blockchain behind collapsed UST, LUNA tokens resumes activity after 9-hour halt
386.article_body: The blockchain behind stablecoin TerraUSD, or UST, and its affiliated LUNA token has resumed activity after a nine-hour halt on Friday. The Terra blockchain had stopped processing new transactions for the second time in less than a day after UST and LUNA collapsed. Several crypto exchanges, including WazirX, CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber, delisted LUNA from their platforms on Friday.

387.title: PBKS record the highest powerplay score of IPL 2022
387.article_body: PBKS today recorded the highest powerplay score of IPL 2022 by scoring 83/1 in their first six overs against RCB. The previous highest powerplay score of IPL 2022 had come on April 20, when DC scored 81/0 against PBKS. PBKS opener Jonny Bairstow scored 59*(22), including seven sixes, in the first six overs today.

388.title: 4 on way to wedding die, 2 hurt as vehicle falls into gorge in Shimla
388.article_body: Four persons, including three women, were killed and two others sustained injuries when their vehicle fell into a 100-metre gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla district, police said. The incident took place when the victims were on their way to attend a wedding. "Primarily, negligent and rash driving caused the accident," Shimla Superintendent of Police Monika Bhutungru said.

389.title: Rock paintings said to be 10,000-30,000 yrs old found in T'gana, pics surface
389.article_body: A Mesolithic age rock art site has been discovered at Kasipeta in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district in Telangana. It was found on a small hillock on private land and is believed to be between 10,000 and 30,000 years old, reports said. The paintings reportedly feature four bisons, two men and an animal bearing a resemblance to a horse.

390.title: Population not sole criteria for delimitation in J&K: CEC Chandra
390.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra on Friday said that population was not the sole criteria while carrying out delimitation exercise in J&K. He mentioned that "physical conditions, and communication facilities, public conveniences and the administrative units" were also considered. Of the 90 assembly constituencies, Jammu region will have 43 seats and Kashmir region will have 47 seats.

391.title: 'Calling a man bald at work is sexual harassment,' rules UK tribunal
391.article_body: An England employment tribunal has ruled that calling a man "bald" in workplace falls within the purview of sexual harassment. It stated that baldness was more prevalent in men than women, adding, "In our judgment, there's a connection between the word 'bald'...and the protected characteristic of sex." The case pertained to a man being called "bald c**t" by his supervisor.

392.title: J&K govt forms SIT to probe Rahul Bhat's killing, to give govt job to his wife
392.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir government has constituted a Special Investigation Team to investigate the murder of Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists on Thursday. The administration will provide a government job to Bhat's wife and financial assistance to his family, J&K LG Manoj Sinha's office said. The government will also bear the educational expenses of his daughter.

393.title: Out-of-control Tesla car crashes into building at 112 km/hr in US, CCTV footage surfaces
393.article_body: CCTV footage showing a Tesla car crashing into the Greater Columbus Convention Center in Ohio, in the US, has surfaced online. The clip shared by Now This News on Twitter shows the vehicle hitting a curb and ramming into the building at the speed of 112 km/hr. The crash caused an estimated damage of more than $250,000.

394.title: Tesla shares gain after Elon Musk puts $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
394.article_body: Shares of Tesla surged 4% on Friday after its CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he has temporarily put the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter on hold. Tesla shares have lost about 25% of their value since Musk disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Meanwhile, Twitter stock plunged 10% after Musk's announcement on Friday.

395.title: Try to learn a new shot every year: PBKS' Jitesh on his form in IPL 2022
395.article_body: Speaking on the secret of his success in his debut IPL season, PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma stated he tries to learn a new shot every year or learn something new. Jitesh has scored 162 runs in nine matches at a strike rate of over 160 in ongoing IPL. "I didn't expect that I would've a season like this," he added.

396.title: 3 J&K govt employees terminated over alleged terror links: Report
396.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) administration has terminated three state government employees, including a professor and a police constable, for their alleged links with terror groups, according to a report. Their termination was based on the recommendation of a designated committee in J&K, the report said. Reportedly, one of the terminated employees had crossed over to Pakistan for terror training.

397.title: Ranveer hosts 'Jayeshbhai...' screening for underprivileged kids
397.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh hosted a screening of his film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' for underprivileged children in Mumbai on Friday. Pictures show the actor cutting cake at the screening and dancing with the children. He said, "I will also choose important films like Jayeshbhai Jordaar that satirically talks about patriarchy and toxic masculinity...It is a film that had to be made."

398.title: Zomato's 10-minute food delivery initiative being re-evaluated: Report
398.article_body: Zomato's 10-minute food delivery service is being re-evaluated as the company was unable to meet time targets for all orders during its Gurugram pilot, Economic Times reported. Shortage of delivery fleet and intense heat wave are causing delivery delays of 15-20 minutes, the report stated. It further said that Zomato has halted plans to initiate 10-minute delivery services in Bengaluru.

399.title: Bus with Vaishno Devi pilgrims catches fire due to overheated tank in J&K, 4 killed
399.article_body: At least four people were killed and around 20 others were injured on Friday when a bus carrying pilgrims to Vaishno Devi caught on fire near Katra in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. The fire was caused by an explosion in the bus tank due to overheating caused by the weather, Reasi Deputy Commissioner Babila Rakwal said.

400.title: People carrying reporter Shireen's coffin clash with Israeli police; video surfaces
400.article_body:
Israeli police clashed with Palestinian mourners carrying Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh's coffin at the start of her funeral procession in Jerusalem on Friday. A video showed the group carrying her coffin almost dropping the casket and saving it just before one end hit the ground. She 
was shot during an Israeli military raid in the West Bank.

401.title: Dhaakad has 14-min fight sequence, longest in Hindi films: Kangana
401.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her upcoming film 'Dhaakad', said that the film has an approximately 14-minute long fight sequence, adding that it is the longest such sequence in Hindi cinema. The actress further said that the Indian film industry should be scared of the American film industry and should come together to save Indian screens from international films.

402.title: Rupinder ruled out of Asia Cup due to wrist injury, Lakra to lead India
402.article_body: Drag-flicker Rupinder Pal Singh has been ruled out of the Asia Cup Hockey, starting from May 23 in Jakarta, due to a wrist injury. Rupinder, who was named captain of the 20-member squad, sustained the injury during a training session. Defender Birendra Lakra will replace Rupinder as captain, while forward SV Sunil will step in as the vice-captain.

403.title: CoinSwitch delists LUNA as it crashes 100%, CEO says 'meltdown is rapid'
403.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber CEO Ashish Singhal on Friday tweeted that the crypto exchange is delisting Terra's LUNA crypto token after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. "The last few days have been tough for all of us...The meltdown of the Terra ecosystem and LUNA have been rapid and devastating," Singhal said, noting that it is "a tough decision".

404.title: BJP chief JP Nadda holds roadshow in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh
404.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda and CM Jairam Thakur held a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh on Friday. Addressing a gathering, Nadda said, "Under the guidance of PM Narendra Modi and CM Jairam Thakur, the people of Himachal Pradesh are eager to give their blessings to BJP again." Notably, Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh are likely to be held later this year.
